description: The “Assistance for Funeral Expenses” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for funeral expenses to the nominees of a deceased registered member.

name: Incentive Scheme for Sericulture Reelers
description: The "Incentive Scheme for Sericulture Reelers" is aimed at improving the financial condition of minority communities involved in silk reeling and spinning. The corporation will provide loans to support working capital and basic infrastructure for silk spinners.

name: Community Based Training Scheme
description: The "Community Based Training Scheme" aims to provide training in heavy vehicle driving, shorthand, security services, office soft skills, retail sales, and beauty parlor courses (male & female) to unemployed young men and women belonging to minority communities for self-employment or employment.

name: Overseas Educational Loan Scheme
description: The "Overseas Educational Loan Scheme" objective is to provide financial/loan assistance to students belonging to minority communities who are pursuing graduate or postgraduate degree courses in recognized universities abroad.

name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Bihar
description: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is provided to persons with disabilities in the age group of 18 to 79 years who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support them financially. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

name: Bihar Disability Pension Scheme
description: The objective of this scheme is to provide social security to the persons with disabilities (PwDs) of the poor family of the society by providing them financial assistance. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is given to PwDs of 40% or more, regardless of their income or age group.

name: Bihar Shatabdi Leper Welfare Scheme
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per month is given to leprosy patients with Visible Deformities Grade-II in the state. This scheme is fully funded by the State Government.

name: Continuation of Pension (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Continuation of Pension'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that provides a monthly pension to registered construction workers who have paid subscriptions for at least three (3) years.

name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to elderly people aged 60 years and above living Below the Poverty Line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life.

name: Pucca Ghar Yojana (Mining)
description: The government of Odisha is committed to providing "Pucca Houses" to all the eligible kutcha households in all the mining-affected Blocks of nine mineral-bearing Districts.

name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹500/- is provided to widows aged 40 to 79 years who are living Below the Poverty Line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

name: Chief Minister EBC Civil Seva Protsahan Yojana
description: The Bihar Government provides incentives to individuals belonging to the EBC Categories upon passing the preliminary examination of various competitive exams such as UPSC, BPSC, NDA, CDS, Banking, Railway, SSC, etc., to support their further preparation for the main examination/interview.

name: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jati Ewam Anusuchit Janjati Civil Sewa Protsahan Yojana
description: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to SC & ST candidates who qualify in the preliminary examination of Civil Services Competitive Examination conducted by the BPSC, Patna, and the UPSC, New Delhi, to support their preparation for main examination/interview.

name: Production of Foundation and Certified Seeds
description: The "Production of Foundation and Certified Seeds" scheme, provides subsidy to farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified seeds to the Department of Agriculture.

name: Distribution of Rhizobium Packets-Oilseeds
description: The “Distribution of Rhizobium Packets-Oilseeds” scheme provides a subsidy on the cost of Rhizobium, to eligible farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds.

name: Distribution of Minikits At Free of Cost
description: The "Distribution of Minikits at Free of Cost" scheme provides subsidies for minikits to maize-growing farmers in some of the selected districts of Tamil Nadu.

name: Samekit Baal Vikas Chhtra Yojana: Dress for Pre-school Children
description: This scheme provides an amount of ₹400/- per child per year for uniforms to all children aged 3 to 6 years receiving pre-school education at Anganwadi Centres. The scheme aims to create a distinct identity for Anganwadi Centre children & bring a sense of uniformity & social harmony among children.

name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹500/- is provided to widows aged 40 to 79 years who are living Below the Poverty Line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
description: Launched on 15th August 1995, the "Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme" is a pension scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir. The scheme provides monthly financial assistance of ₹1,000/- to Below Poverty Line (BPL) individuals.

name: Free Education Scholarship for Professional Courses (Engineering, Medical, Agriculture, Veterinary, and Law)
description: This scheme provides full coverage of tuition fees, special fees, and examination fees for Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) students pursuing professional courses.

name: Grant for Purchase of Tools (BBOCWWB)
description: The scheme is implemented by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Under this scheme, registered construction workers who have completed skill upgradation training are provided financial assistance of upto ₹15,000/- for purchasing trade-related tools.

name: Burial Ground-Provision of Burial Grounds and Pathway to Burial Grounds
description: The scheme aims to support Adi Dravidar/Tribal communities by providing burial grounds and pathways in areas where such facilities are not available.

name: Visit of Contract Farming Farmers to the Research Stations in Karnataka
description: The scheme “Visit of Contract Farming Farmers to the Research Stations in Karnataka” facilitates visits for contract farming farmers to research stations across Karnataka to gain agricultural knowledge. Financial support is provided for a 3-day visit.

name: Training of Farmers on Pulses Production Technologies
description: The “Training of Farmers on Pulses Production Technologies” scheme aims to educate farmers on advanced pulses production technologies to enhance crop yield.

name: Maternity Benefit to the Female Beneficiary
description: The Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board (MBOCWWB) provide "Maternity Benefit" to female workers registered under the Act. Financial assistance is provided in cases of miscarriage or medical termination of pregnancy, up to two times.

name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
description: Launched on 15th August 1995, the "Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme" is a pension scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir. The scheme provides monthly financial assistance of ₹1,000/- to Below Poverty Line (BPL) individuals.

name: Workers for Class 9th to 12th Through National Scholarship (JKBOCWWB)
description: Launched on 1st January 2018, the "Workers for Class 9th to 12th" scheme, under the MUHAFIZ Scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Dept., J&K, provides ₹1,200 per year for up to two children of registered BOC workers through the National Scholarship Portal.

name: Free Education Scholarship for Professional Courses (Engineering, Medical, Agriculture, Veterinary, and Law)
description: This scheme provides full coverage of tuition fees, special fees, and examination fees for Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) students pursuing professional courses.

name: Awards to Bright Students
description: The "Awards to Bright Students" scheme offers financial assistance to the top two boys and two girls from Adi Dravidar/Tribal/Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity in each district who have excelled in their 10th standard public examinations and continue their studies.

name: Prize Schemes to the Students (State Level Prizes)
description: The scheme awards students from Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC), and Denotified Communities (DNC) for their excellent performance in academic exams studying in Government/Government Aided and Private Schools.

name: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Power Tiller
description: The scheme offers loans to farmers covering up to 90% of the cost of a power tiller, with an interest rate between 11% and 12.25%.
tags: ['Agriculture And Rural Development Bank', 'Farmer', 'Farming Equipment', 'Loan', 'Power Tiller']

name: Mukhyamantri Aadim Jan Jati Pension Yojana
description: The Mukhyamantri Aadim Jan Jati Pension Yojana, launched on 08-07-2015 by the Jharkhand Government, provides financial assistance to primitive tribal families. The pension is given to the adult married woman or, if none, the male head of the family.

name: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Poultry Development
description: The scheme offers loans to farmers for poultry development and cattle development, with funding of up to ₹14,800/- for 200 birds or ₹17,000/- for 2 cows, with an interest rate of 14.5% to 16.5%.
tags: ['Agriculture And Rural Development Bank', 'Cattle Development', 'Farmer', 'Loan', 'Poultry Development']

name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)
description: The "Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)" is implemented by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept., Govt. of Maharashtra. The differently-abled individuals aged 18 to 65 years with a disability of 80% and above are eligible to receive a pension of ₹600/- per month.

name: Providing Tin stalls to Gatai Kamgar
description: "Providing Tin Stalls to Gatai Kamgar" is a social welfare scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance of the Government of Maharashtra. The scheme aims to uplift Scheduled Caste individuals engaged in leather footwear production and leather goods preparation.

name: Stipend to Educated Unemployed
description: Under this scheme, provides a stipend of ₹650 per month to assist 25 educated persons with disabilities who have registered in an Employment Exchange for over three years and have not been placed in gainful employment.

name: Yashwantrao Chavan Mukta Vasahat Yojana for VJNTs
description: The scheme "Yashwantrao Chavan Mukta Vasahat Yojana for VJNTs," was launched by the Dept of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt of Maharashtra. Each VJNT family will receive a plot of land measuring 5 gunthas (approximately 500 square meters or about 5,382 square feet).

name: Educational Assistance for Government Recognised Diploma Courses
description: The Educational Assistance for Government Recognised Diploma Courses scheme is designed to financially support children of registered construction workers, providing ₹20,000 per year for diploma courses and ₹25,000/- per year for postgraduate diploma courses.

name: Funeral Assistance
description: Under this scheme, the “Maharashtra Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board” (MBOCWW) provides financial assistance for funeral expenses of ₹10,000/- to the nominated heir of the deceased registered worker in the event of their death.

name: Large Sized Multi Purpose Coop. Society: Jewel Loan (Interest Free)
description: The scheme offers citizens interest-free loans up to ₹1,00,000/- on jewels, helping them meet various financial needs without the burden of interest rates.

name: Lalima Abhiyaan
description: The Lalima Abhiyaan aims to improve the health of children, adolescent girls, and women of reproductive age, and focuses on the prevention of anemia and nutrition awareness among adolescent girls.

name: Mukhyamantri Nijee Nalkup Yojana
description: The scheme provides financial assistance to support farmers in ensuring water availability through borewell construction and motor pump installation.

name: Senior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)
description: Launched on 1st January 1966, the scheme "Senior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides free accommodation and mess facilities to students from studying in Class 9th to 12th in a government/recognized school.

name: Guruji Student Credit Card (GSCC) Scheme
description: Under this scheme, a financial support initiative by the Jharkhand Government to help students pursue higher education without financial constraints. Under this scheme, eligible students can avail of education loans up to ₹15,00,000 at a subsidized 4% simple interest rate, with additional benefits.

name: Study Abroad Scholarships (Scheduled Tribe)
description: Launched in 2003, the scheme "Study Abroad Scholarships" by the Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh covers tuition fees of 40,000 US Dollars per year, along with a living allowance of 9,000 US Dollars and a contingency allowance of 1,000 US Dollars.

name: Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Housing (Rural) Scheme
description: Launched in 2013, the "Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Housing (Rural) Scheme" provides permanent houses to registered construction workers in rural areas of Madhya Pradesh.

name: Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Permanent Partial Disability
description: “Permanent Partial Disability” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” launched by the Labour Resources Dept, Bihar, provides financial assistance of ₹37,500/- to the families of workers or craftsmen in case of permanent partial disablement.

name: Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana: Accidental Injuries
description: The component “Accidental Injuries” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” launched by the Labour Resources Department, Bihar, provides financial assistance to the workers or craftsmen in case of accidental injuries.

name: Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Urban Housing Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
description: The scheme was revised in 2018, the "Chief Minister's Building and Other Construction Workers Urban Housing Scheme," to provide an additional ₹1,00,000 assistance to eligible construction workers in urban areas, along with grants from the Central and State Governments.

name: Jharkhand Patrakar Samman Pension Niyamawali
description: The "Jharkhand Patrakar Samman Pension Niyamawali" aims to provide financial assistance to journalists who have served the state for an extended period. It ensures their well-being post-retirement and acknowledges their contribution to media and society.

name: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jaati Vishesh Pariyojana Vitt Poshan Yojana
description: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jaati Vishesh Pariyojana Vitt Poshan Yojana" under the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste Department, Madhya Pradesh, aims to provide financial assistance for special project proposals received in the interest of the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.

name: Jharkhand State Scheduled Tribe Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme
description: The "Jharkhand State Scheduled Tribe Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme" aims to promote higher education among scheduled tribe students in Jharkhand. The scheme provides financial assistance to students pursuing professional and academic courses at the post-matriculation level.

name: Junior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)
description: Launched on 1st January 1966, the scheme "Junior Hostel" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides free accommodation and mess facilities to students studying in classes 6th to 8th.

name: Aahar Anudan Yojana
description: The scheme "Aahar Anudan Yojana" provides monthly assistance of ₹1,000 to students, girls, and women from backward tribes like Baiga, Bharia, and Saharia. The scheme aims to combat malnutrition among special tribal families by ensuring access to nutritious food through financial assistance.

name: Incentive For The Simple Marriage (Scheduled Tribe)
description: The scheme "Incentive for the Simple Marriage" was launched by the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka. The scheme provides an incentive of ₹50,000/- to ST individuals residing in Karnataka who marry another ST individual on or after 11th August 2015.

name: Mukhyamantri Nijee Nalkup Yojana
description: The scheme provides financial assistance to support farmers in ensuring water availability through borewell construction and motor pump installation.

description: “Permanent Partial Disability” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” launched by the Labour Resources Dept, Bihar, provides financial assistance of ₹37,500/- to the families of workers or craftsmen in case of permanent partial disablement.

description: The component “Accidental Injuries” under the “Bihar Shatabdi Asangathit Karyakshetra Kamagaar Evan Shilpakar Samajik Suraksha Yojana” launched by the Labour Resources Department, Bihar, provides financial assistance to the workers or craftsmen in case of accidental injuries.

description: The "Jharkhand Patrakar Samman Pension Niyamawali" aims to provide financial assistance to journalists who have served the state for an extended period. It ensures their well-being post-retirement and acknowledges their contribution to media and society.

name: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jaati Vishesh Pariyojana Vitt Poshan Yojana
description: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jaati Vishesh Pariyojana Vitt Poshan Yojana" under the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste Department, Madhya Pradesh, aims to provide financial assistance for special project proposals received in the interest of the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.

name: Housing Assistance (Madhya Pradesh)
description: The scheme "Housing Assistance (Madhya Pradesh)" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides housing support to tribal boys and girls pursuing higher education outside their hometown, where hostels are not available.

name: Jharkhand State Scheduled Tribe Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme
description: The "Jharkhand State Scheduled Tribe Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme" aims to promote higher education among scheduled tribe students in Jharkhand. The scheme provides financial assistance to students pursuing professional and academic courses at the post-matriculation level.

name: Junior Hostel (Scheduled Tribes)
description: Launched on 1st January 1966, the scheme "Junior Hostel" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste (SC) Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh provides free accommodation and mess facilities to students studying in classes 6th to 8th.

name: Sant Ravi Das Swarojgaar Yojana
description: The Sant Ravi Das Swarojgaar Yojana under the Tribal Welfare and SC Department, Madhya Pradesh, provides funding for manufacturing units (₹1 lakh to ₹50 lakh) and service/retail trade projects (₹1 lakh to ₹25 lakh) for Scheduled Caste applicants.

name: Jharkhand State Scheduled Caste Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme
description: The "Jharkhand State Scheduled Caste Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme" enhances the participation of Scheduled Caste students in pre-matric education and provides them with equal educational opportunities. The scheme aims to encourage students to continue their education and reduce dropout rates.......

name: Aahar Anudan Yojana
description: The scheme "Aahar Anudan Yojana" provides monthly assistance of ₹1,000 to students, girls, and women from backward tribes like Baiga, Bharia, and Saharia. The scheme aims to combat malnutrition among special tribal families by ensuring access to nutritious food through financial assistance.

name: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Janjati Gram Vikas Yojana
description: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Janjati Gram Vikas Yojana" by the Welfare Department, Govt. of Jharkhand, aims to uplift Scheduled Tribe communities through education, health, & economic initiatives. Financial grants, equipment, & training programs are provided for holistic village development.

name: Birsa Awas Nirman Yojana
description: The "Birsa Awas Nirman Yojana" by the Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand, provides financial assistance in three installments for housing construction to Scheduled Tribes, along with a ₹500 incentive for monitoring agencies for timely completion.

name: Kisan Suryoday Yojana (KSY)
description: "Kisan Suryoday Yojana (KSY)" is a Gujarat government initiative launched in 2020-2021 to provide daytime electricity for agricultural activities, utilizing solar and non-conventional energy.

name: Madhya Pradesh Professional Talent Examination Award Scheme
description: "M.P. Professional Talent Examination Award Scheme" aims to recognize and reward backward-class students who excel in professional entrance examinations. Monetary awards are provided to backward-class students who secure the top three positions in entrance examinations like PET, PPT, and MCA.

name: Backward Class Students Meritorious Award Scheme
description: "Backward Classes Student Merit Award Scheme" aims to recognize and reward academic excellence among backward-class students. Monetary awards are provided to one boy and one girl student from backward classes who secure the highest marks at the district level in class 10th and 12th board exams.

name: Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme
description: The “Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme” aims to provide financial support to retired athletes for their lifelong contribution to sports. Athletes, including Arjuna, Dronacharya, and Dhyan Chand awardees, Olympic participants, and Commonwealth or Asian Games medalists, receive a monthly pension.

name: Construction of Godown for Grain Storage
description: Launched on 24th December 2013, the scheme "Construction of Warehouse for Grain Storage" by the Panchayat and Rural Development Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh aims to provide modern and scientific food grain storage facilities under Food Security Act 13 to applicants in rural areas.

name: Mukhyamantri Vas Sthal Kray Sahayata Yojana
description: This scheme provides financial assistance to landless beneficiaries for purchasing residential land, ensuring housing for the underprivileged in rural Bihar.

name: Scheme for Supply of Male Goat on Subsidy Basis
description: "Male Goat Supply Scheme on Grant Basis" aims to improve the breed of indigenous/local goats throughout the state. Through this scheme, one male goat of an improved breed (Jamnapari, Barbari, or Sirohi Bakra) is provided to goat farmers of all categories on a grant basis.

name: Advanced Animal Breeding Scheme (Supply of Breedable Pedigree Murrah Bull on Subsidy)
description: "Advanced Animal Breeding Scheme (Supply of Breedable Pedigree Murrah Bulls on Subsidy)" aims to improve cattle breeding by supplying pedigreed breedable Murrah bulls to progressive cattle rearers and trained cow servants. Murrah bulls are provided with a 75% subsidy to animal keepers.

name: Jharkhand State Scheduled Caste Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme
description: The "Jharkhand State Scheduled Caste Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme" enhances the participation of Scheduled Caste students in pre-matric education and provides them with equal educational opportunities. The scheme aims to encourage students to continue their education and reduce dropout rates.......

name: Scheduled Tribe Relief Scheme
description: Launched on 31st March 2017, the "Scheduled Tribe Relief Scheme" by the Tribal Welfare and Scheduled Caste Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides immediate support for destitute tribal brides and assistance to disabled, elderly, blind, and impoverished individuals.

name: Haryana Pre Matric Scholarship For Minority
description: Launched in June 2006 under the Prime Minister's New 15 Point Programme for the Welfare of Minorities, the "Pre-Matric Scholarship for Students Belonging to the Minority Communities" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme by the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India.

name: Kisan Samriddhi Yojana Jharkhand
description: The "Kisan Samriddhi Yojana" by the Department of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry & Cooperative, Government of Jharkhand, promotes solar-powered irrigation systems to reduce agricultural costs and dependency on fossil fuels. Farmers receive up to 90% subsidy for solar units under this initiative.

name: National Agriculture Insurance Scheme
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: The National Agriculture Insurance Scheme (NAIS) was introduced by the Government of India to provide comprehensive insurance coverage and financial support to farmers against crop losses due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.

name: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs: Net SGST reimbursement to Micro, Small and Medium Manufacturing Enterprise (MSMEs):
description: The "Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs" aims to empower the state's dynamic MSME sector, which significantly contributes to employment, GDP, and exports.

name: State Scholarship for Class 6th to 10th (Denotified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic )
description: The "State Scholarship for Classes 6th to 10th" scheme provides an annual scholarship ranging from ₹200/- to ₹1,200/- (for 10 months) to the students belonging to De-notified, Nomadic, and Semi-Nomadic communities studying in classes 6th to 10th.

name: Doodh Sanjivani Scheme
description: The scheme aims to enhance the nutritional health of children aged 6 months to 6 years and pregnant and lactating mothers by providing fortified flavored milk in Anganwadi centers across 20 districts in the state.

name: Sanitary Pad Supply Scheme
description: The "Sanitary Pad Supply Scheme" by the Women, Child Development & Social Security Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to promote hygiene and health among women and adolescent girls. It provides free sanitary pads quarterly to women aged 20–40 years through Anganwadi centers.

name: Mukhyamantri Ati Pichhada Varg Udyami Yojana
description: This is a flagship scheme of the Bihar government aimed at promoting entrepreneurship and self-employment among the youth by providing financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- for setting up businesses.

name: Compensation Amount Towards Cattle Injury Caused by Forest Animals
description: Launched on 6th February 2024, the scheme "Compensation Amount towards Cattle Injury Caused by Forest Animals" by the Forest Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides compensation in case of death of cattle due to attacks by wild animals.

name: Nursing Kaushal College Jharkhand
description: The "Nursing Skill College" scheme provides skill-based nursing education and employment opportunities to young women, especially from disadvantaged backgrounds. The scheme offers free residential training, modern learning facilities, and placement support.

name: Female Child Birth Gift Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
description: The "Female Child Birth Gift Scheme" by the HPBOCWWB offers ₹51,000/- for each of two daughters of registered beneficiaries. The amount is deposited in a Fixed Deposit Receipt (FDR) and can be withdrawn once the daughter turns 18, ensuring long-term financial security.

name: Admission in Post Matric Hostel
description: The scheme was launched on 1st January1900, the scheme "Admission in Post Matric Hostel" by the Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides free accommodation to backward class students to support their education.

name: Paddy Procurement Scheme Jharkhand
description: The "Paddy Procurement Scheme" 2012-13" by the Food, Public Distribution, and Consumer Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, ensures that farmers receive minimum support price for paddy procurement, preventing distress sales and supporting food security.

name: Kharmore Sonchidia Award Scheme
description: In the scheme "Kharmore Sonchidia Award" by the Forest Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, the farmers are rewarded with ₹5,000/- if a Kharmor bird is sighted in the private land of the farmer and ₹10,000/- if a Golden bird is sighted in the private land of the farmer.

name: Rearing Pond Construction Scheme
description: The "Rearing Pond Construction Scheme" by the Department of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Cooperation, Government of Jharkhand, aims to promote fish farming by providing financial aid for constructing rearing ponds. Beneficiaries receive up to 80% government assistance for Scheduled Castes (SC)

name: INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)
description: "INDIRAMMA Disabled Pension (Rural)" scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to the individuals 18 years or above in age and having a disability of 40% or above. To be eligible, they should be from a BPL family, be a resident of the district, and not be covered under any other Pension Scheme.

name: Haryana Gaurav Samman Scheme for Padma Awardees
description: The scheme seeks to honour the exceptional achievements of citizens of Haryana who have excelled in fields of sports, arts, literature, education, public affairs, social work, science, technology, medicine, industry and other domains of public life.

name: Financial Assistance to Widower and Unmarried Persons Scheme : For Widower
description: The aim of the scheme is to provide Social Security to Widowers who are unable to sustain themselves from their own sources and are in need of financial assistance from the State.

name: Pension Scheme to Disabled Persons (Divyangjan)
state: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
description: The scheme is implemented by the Social Welfare Department to provide financial assistance to individuals with disabilities. The primary objective is to provide financial benefits to eligible Divyangjan to cater to their basic needs. The scheme is targeted at Divyangjan aged between 18 to 59 years.

name: Pashudhan Mitra Scheme
description: Launched on 20th June 2013, the scheme "Pashudhan Mitra Scheme1" by the Animal Husbandry Department, Govt of Chhattisgarh, aims to expand veterinary and breeding services, strengthen service delivery, and provide incentive honorariums to Pashudhan Mitras for livelihood support.

name: Transgender Utthan Kosh – Identity Card for Transgender
description: This scheme aims to identify transgender persons and issuing identity cards to them. This certificate/identity card will be valid for all government purposes, including obtaining a ration card, Aadhaar card, birth certificate, etc.

name: Haryana Gaurav Samman Scheme for Padma Awardees
description: The scheme seeks to honour the exceptional achievements of citizens of Haryana who have excelled in fields of sports, arts, literature, education, public affairs, social work, science, technology, medicine, industry and other domains of public life.

name: Financial Assistance to Widower and Unmarried Persons Scheme : For Widower
description: The aim of the scheme is to provide Social Security to Widowers who are unable to sustain themselves from their own sources and are in need of financial assistance from the State.

name: Haryana State Merit Scholarship Scheme
description: The scheme aims to support meritorious students from economically backward sections in pursuing higher education. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to students pursuing Degree, Post-Graduate, and Doctorate courses.

name: Scheme for Relief and Rehabilitation of Women Acid Victims
description: Under the scheme, the acid attack victim is entitled to receive 100% free medical treatment from government or government-approved hospitals. Additionally, an ad-hoc relief of ₹1.00 lakh is provided to the acid attack victim, which is later reimbursed by the Women and Child Development Department.

name: Mukhyamantri Vishesh Yogyajan Swaraozgar Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to specially-abled individuals for self-employment. Under this scheme, a loan of ₹5,00,000/- will be provided to specially-abled individuals in the state whose annual family income does not exceed ₹2,00,000/-, enabling them to start their own business.

name: Incentive Scheme For The Electricity Consumers Under Various Categories In Andaman & Nicobar Islands
description: "Incentive Scheme For The Electricity Consumers Under Various Categories In Andaman & Nicobar Islands" aims to reduce power consumption through demand side management and promote green energy adoption. The scheme offers monetary incentives to consumers who achieve at least 30% energy savings.

name: Reimbursement of Tution Fee for SC/ST/OBC/Min students in Public Schools in Class I to XII
description: The scheme aims to provide financial support by reimbursing tuition and compulsory fees for SC/ST/OBC students from low-income families (below ₹3,00,000/- per annum) studying in recognized schools in Delhi. Beneficiaries must meet academic and attendance criteria.

name: Interest Subvention Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide institutional credit for capital investments at reasonable interest rates and is implemented through the Karnataka State Financial Corporation (KSFC) in the state.

name: Grant of Financial Incentives for Hotels, Resorts, and Tourism Projects
description: The scheme aims to promote tourism infrastructure by providing financial incentives to hotels, resorts, heritage hotels, and other tourism projects. The scheme offers capital grants and subsidies to eligible applicants who have invested in and developed tourism-related projects.

name: Wire Fencing Around the Farm for Crop Protection
description: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to protect farmers' crops from damage caused by wild and stray animals by providing financial assistance for wire fencing around farms.

name: HSCST Fellowship Programme
description: In order to attract talented & meritorious students, HSCSIT is offering research fellowships in various fields of Science & Technology & Medical Sciences. The fellowships will involve full time research work leading to Ph.D. degree from any of the Institute/University in Haryana.

name: Reimbursement of Tution Fee for SC/ST/OBC/Min students in Public Schools in Class I to XII
description: The scheme aims to provide financial support by reimbursing tuition and compulsory fees for SC/ST/OBC students from low-income families (below ₹3,00,000/- per annum) studying in recognized schools in Delhi. Beneficiaries must meet academic and attendance criteria.

name: Incentive Scheme For The Electricity Consumers Under Various Categories In Andaman & Nicobar Islands
description: "Incentive Scheme For The Electricity Consumers Under Various Categories In Andaman & Nicobar Islands" aims to reduce power consumption through demand side management and promote green energy adoption. The scheme offers monetary incentives to consumers who achieve at least 30% energy savings.

name: Coconut Development Scheme
description: The "Coconut Development Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support farmers by providing quality coconut saplings and financial assistance for coconut cultivation.

name: Foreign Education Scheme
description: The "Foreign Education Scheme" provides financial assistance for non-reserved category students pursuing higher education abroad after Standard 12.

name: Financial Assistance for the Treatment of Blind, Disabled, Deaf, Dumb, or Mentally Challenged Ex-Servicemen and their Dependents (Wife and Children)
description: The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance for the treatment of ex-servicemen and their dependents (wife & children) who have a disability of 40% or more and are suffering from serious illnesses such as cancer, leprosy, tuberculosis, kidney and cardiac ailments, paralysis, etc.

name: Incentive to Owners of A.I. Born Female Calf through Pure Breeding in Indigenous Cow Across the State
description: The scheme aims to support livestock owners in maintaining and increasing the population of indigenous cattle breeds like Gir and Kankrej.

name: World War II Pension
description: The aim of the scheme is to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹15,000/- per month as a measure of relief to World War II ex-servicemen and their widows who are not receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source.

name: Group Insurance Scheme for Powerloom Weavers
description: The basic objective of this scheme is to provide insurance cover to the powerloom weavers in the case of natural death, accidental death as well as partial and permanent disability due to accident.

name: Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana
description: The KVPY is a national fellowship program in basic sciences, initiated and funded by the Department of Science and Technology to attract exceptionally motivated students to pursue basic science courses and a research career in science.

name: Mukhyamantri Alpasankhyak Medhwi Balika Protsahan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide financial incentives to meritorious girl students belonging to minority communities based on their performance in the High School Examination or its equivalent (Munshi/Maulvi) and Intermediate Examination or its equivalent (Alim).

name: Bhed Palan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote sheep rearing as a source of self-employment and livelihood generation for eligible beneficiaries, particularly from SECC categories, by providing financial support for rearing a sheep unit.

name: Bakri Palan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote goat rearing as a source of self-employment and livelihood generation for eligible beneficiaries, particularly from SECC categories, by providing financial support for rearing a goat unit.

name: Compensation in Animal Death
description: The "Compensation in Animal Death" scheme introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, provides financial assistance to animal breeders who suffer livestock losses due to natural disasters, diseases, or poisoning.

name: Supply of Fodder Minikit
description: The "Supply of Fodder Minikit" scheme introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide improved varieties of fodder seeds to farmers.

name: Assistance for Cattleshed, Gaman, Water Tank and Bucket
description: The scheme "Assistance for Cattleshed, Gaman, Water Tank and Bucket" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat, aims to support livestock farmers by offering financial assistance for essential infrastructure such as cattle sheds, gaman, water tanks, and buckets.

name: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R./Kadaknath & 1000 Broiler Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training for Scheduled Tribes People of the State
description: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance and training stipends to Scheduled Tribe (ST) individuals in Gujarat for poultry farming.

name: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Tribe Category)
description: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Tribe Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to Scheduled Tribe Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

name: Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Caste Category)
description: This scheme provides free BIS type II concentrate feed to pregnant cattle owned by Scheduled Caste Category livestock owners in Gujarat to ensure their good health, boost immunity, prevent metabolic diseases, and enhance milk production.

name: COP-34 Financial Assistance to Farmer for Interest Subvention (Kishan Credit Card Interest Asst.)

name: To Provide Interest Subvention to Animal Husbandry of the State at the Rate of 4% to the Beneficiaries Kisan Credit Card
description: The scheme aims to provide 4% interest subvention to cattle breeders in Gujarat on timely repayment of short-term loans taken through the Kisan Credit Card for animal husbandry activities.

description: The "Agro Service Provider Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, aims to support farmers by providing subsidies for acquiring agricultural implements.

name: Anya Pichhda Varg Kalyan Chhatravaas

name: Assistance for Cultivation of Medicinal/ Aromatic Crops
description: The scheme provides financial assistance up to 75% of the cost or ₹11,250/- per hectare (whichever is lower) to farmers in Gujarat cultivating medicinal or aromatic crops on land between 0.20 and 4 hectares.

name: Combined Merit Scholarship
description: The scheme aims to provide merit-based scholarship to students of Assam studying in first semester degree and master degree courses in recognized institutions. It benefits academically meritorious students who have obtained at least 60% marks in their last qualifying examination.

name: Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme
description: The scheme "Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students for pursuing medical, engineering, diploma, and higher education courses.

name: Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana
description: The scheme "Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana (8620)" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote science education by providing financial assistance to students enrolling in the science stream in Class 11th and 12th.

name: Soil Health Card Scheme - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to provide Soil Health Cards to all farmers in the state, helping them understand the nutrient composition of their soil and the type and quantity of fertilizers suitable for their crops.

name: PMMSY:  Establishment of Bio-toilets in mechanised fishing vessels - Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to provide sanitation facilities on mechanised fishing vessels. It provides financial assistance depending on category, with once-in-a-lifetime eligibility.

name: PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregivers
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The scheme aims to train and create a professional cadre of geriatric caregivers to meet the increasing demand for specialized care for senior citizens. It offers skill development and certification in geriatric care job roles to Indian citizens, ensuring professional services for the elderly.

name: Orientation Courses in Dramatics
description: The "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" scheme by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. It offers preliminary training and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, such as script writing and acting, to individuals and existing tiatr artistes.

name: P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying
description: The aim of the scheme is to train and develop skilled youth of Uttarakhand, aged between 18 to 30 years, who are educated, mentally, and physically fit, to become professional paragliding pilots and instructors.

name: Raising the Standard of Tiatr
description: The scheme aims to improve the quality and standard of Tiatr, the popular dramatic form of Goa. It benefits actors, directors, script writers, and backstage artists by reimbursing ticket costs for witnessing high-standard dramas to enhance performance quality.

name: Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technical Diploma in Professional Courses
description: The scheme aims to support ST students enrolled in ITIs and recognized training institutes by providing a monthly stipend of ₹400 for a duration of 12 months.

name: Orientation Courses in Dramatics
description: The "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" scheme by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. It offers preliminary training and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, such as script writing and acting, to individuals and existing tiatr artistes.

name: P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying
description: The aim of the scheme is to train and develop skilled youth of Uttarakhand, aged between 18 to 30 years, who are educated, mentally, and physically fit, to become professional paragliding pilots and instructors.

name: Raising the Standard of Tiatr
description: The scheme aims to improve the quality and standard of Tiatr, the popular dramatic form of Goa. It benefits actors, directors, script writers, and backstage artists by reimbursing ticket costs for witnessing high-standard dramas to enhance performance quality.

name: Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technical Diploma in Professional Courses
description: The scheme aims to support ST students enrolled in ITIs and recognized training institutes by providing a monthly stipend of ₹400 for a duration of 12 months.

name: Special Basic Mountaineering Course
description: The scheme aims to enhance mountaineering skills among youth, prepare them to become certified guides, and promote adventure tourism in Uttarakhand.

name: Ex-Gratia Payment for Life-Threatening Injury Requiring Hospital Stay for Treatment
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals who sustain life-threatening injuries due to disasters and require hospitalization for treatment.

name: Educational Travel Promotion Scheme
description: The "Educational Travel Promotion Scheme" by the Department of Education, aims to promote personality development, observation skills, and curiosity among students through funding educational tours.

name: Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritorious Sportspersons
description: The Government of Sikkim has been providing Cash Incentive Awards to Meritorious Sports persons of Sikkim who have won Gold, Silver, Bronze in the respective sports disciplines at the Zonal Level competitions and above, and have represented Sikkim in international competitions as National team(s).
tags: ['Provision Of Cash Incentive Awards To Meritorious Sportspersons Of Sikkim']

name: Medical Check-Up facility (UKBOCWWB)
description: The scheme aims to provide medical check-up facilities to registered construction workers through door-to-door visits, health camps, and collection centers.

name: Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Quintets/Choral Songs
description: The scheme aims to preserve the traditional concept of singing of duets/duos/trios/quartets/quintets/choral songs which has been on the decline. It provides cash prizes and certificates to singers participating in various traditional singing categories.

name: State Level Sports Awards - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to recognize players and coaches from Uttarakhand who have achieved remarkable success at the national and international levels in sports by awarding them the Khel Ratna, Himalaya Ratna, and Dronacharya Awards.

name: Support for Marginalized Individuals for Livelihood and Enterprise (SMILE): Composite Medical Health for Transgender Persons
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The scheme aims to provide health Insurance coverage to all Transgender persons living in India to improve their health condition through proper treatment including sex re-assignment surgeries as well as medical support. The scheme provides health insurance in the form of Ayushman Bharat Plus.

name: Information, Monitoring, Evaluation and Social Audit (I-MESA): Project Monitoring Unit (PMU)
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The scheme aims to intensely examine the implementation of schemes at the ground level and monitor scheme outputs and outcomes to ensure the quality of services being provided under these schemes. The scheme component provides for physical inspection of every scheme of the Ministry.

name: AVYAY - National Action Plan for Senior Citizens: Health and Shelter for Senior Citizens
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The scheme aims to improve the quality of life of Senior Citizens, particularly those who are indigent, by providing basic amenities like shelter, food, medical care and entertainment opportunities. The scheme provides financial assistance for projects such as maintenance of Senior Citizen Homes.

name: Samriddhi – Scheme for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Students for Setting Start-Ups
description: The scheme aims to provide opportunities for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students to design, launch, and run their own business or startup after formal education is completed or during their final year of education. The scheme provides a limited one-time financial assistance of ₹20,00,000/-.

name: Assistance for Completely Damaged/Destroyed Houses
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals whose residential houses have been completely or partially damaged due to natural disasters in Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, compensation is provided to disaster-affected families to support them in rebuilding or repairing their homes.

name: Scheme for Providing Soft Skill Training Courses to Students Studying in State Colleges
description: The scheme aims to enhance the soft skills of students studying in state colleges of Uttarakhand by providing training through Mahindra Pride Classroom and the Nandi Foundation.
tags: ['College', 'Mahindra Pride Class Room', 'Nandi Foundation', 'Soft Skill Training', 'Student']

name: Ex-Gratia Payment for Life-Threatening Injury Requiring Hospital Stay for Treatment
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals who sustain life-threatening injuries due to disasters and require hospitalization for treatment.

name: Sub-Mission on Agricultural Extension (SMAE)
description: he scheme aims to promote the adoption of modern and scientific farming practices among farmers across the state through continuous training, practical demonstrations, and exposure visits.

name: Akhil Bhartiya Veda Sammelan and Akhil Bhartiya Jyotish Vastu Sammelan
description: The scheme aims to provide a platform for scholars engaged in the study, teaching, propagation, and research of Vedas, Astrology, and Vastu Shastra to participate in the conference.

name: CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar
description: The scheme aims to celebrate the unique contribution of some of the finest teachers in the state and to honour those teachers who through their commitment and industry have not only improved the quality of school education but also enriched the lives of their students.

name: Young Achievers Awards
description: The scheme aims to recognize young talented artistes who have contributed and continue to work for the development of tiatr, its song and music, and have enriched Konkani Tiatr and Song through All India Radio, Doordarshan and other platforms at national and international levels.

name: Loan For Foreign Study (E.B.C.)
description: The scheme aims to support higher education abroad for eligible students from the Educationally Backward Class (EBC). It provides a maximum Foreign Study Loan of ₹15,00,000/- at an annual interest rate of 4% to EBC students.

name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Medical Treatment
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists and their dependent family members for medical treatment expenses. It covers major or minor surgical treatment costs in local or outstation hospitals, including travelling and accommodation expenses.

name: Vidhyadeep Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide accidental insurance cover to students studying in all Primary, Secondary, and Higher Secondary schools across Gujarat State. It offers financial assistance up to ₹50,000/- in case of accidental death or permanent disability to the student's parent or successor.

name: Asian Agri-History Foundation Research Fellowship (M.Sc. Agriculture - All Disciplines)
description: The scheme aims to provide financial support to meritorious students pursuing an M.Sc. in Agriculture across all disciplines by awarding a monthly fellowship of ₹1,200/- for one year.

name: Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi
description: The scheme aims to guide farmers and youth in biotechnology-based farming and animal husbandry by providing technical training and solutions to enhance self-employment and income generation.

name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for Self Employment
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance not exceeding ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, to needy Goan artists or their families for setting up self-employment ventures, helping them establish sustainable income sources. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.

name: Organization of Various Conclaves and Felicitations to Encourage Women, Women Scientists, Teachers and Young Students
description: The scheme aims to promote and enhance scientific attitude and skill development of women, women scientists, teachers, and young students of the state by organizing conclaves and felicitating them.

name: USERC Establishment and Operation of Entrepreneurship Development Centers
description: The scheme aims to establish and operate Entrepreneurship Development Centers to provide structured training in entrepreneurship to students, women, and the general public of Uttarakhand.

name: Compensation for Livestock Loss Caused by Wild Animals
description: The scheme aims to provide financial relief to livestock owners for losses due to wild animal attacks.

name: S.T. Bus Pass Fee Concession Scheme For Government/ Non Government Primary, Secondary & Higher Secondary and Higher Technical Education Students
description: The scheme aims to provide concession in bus fare fees to the students studying in Primary, Secondary, Higher Secondary, and Higher Secondary Technical Education in Government and Non-Government schools. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Road Transport Corporation (GSRTC).

name: Mukhyamantri Dairy Plus Programme (Provision of 02 Murrah Buffaloes on Subsidy)
description: The scheme aims to increase milk production and promote improved livestock breeding by providing two Murrah buffaloes to eligible farmers on a subsidy basis.

name: Dr. Y.V. Singh Award for Best Thesis in Vegetable Science
description: The scheme aims to recognize and encourage students for their outstanding research work in the field of Vegetable Science. Under this, a cash award of ₹20,000/- is provided annually to the selected students.

name: Bal Shakti Yojana
description: The scheme aims to reduce severe malnutrition and child mortality by providing free institutional care, diet, and medical treatment to severely malnourished children below 5 years of age.

name: Goa State Logistics and Warehousing Incentives Scheme: Subsidy towards Investment of Fixed Capital
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for developing the logistics and warehousing industry in Goa. It offers a capital subsidy of 10% or 15% (up to ₹50,00,000/- yearly) towards fixed asset investment for eligible logistics and warehousing entities.

name: Sthaniya Fasal Protsahan Karyakram
description: The program aims to promote the cultivation of local crops, enhance productivity, ensure the use of quality seeds, and provide fair prices to farmers in the mountain districts of Uttarakhand.
tags: ['Agriculture', 'Crop Promotion Program', 'Farmer', 'Local Crop', 'Seed Production', 'Subsidy On Seed']

name: Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Kamdhenu Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide business opportunities in the dairy sector especially to unemployed youths, increase milk production, strengthen economic condition and farmers will get economic benefits even in adverse circumstances.

name: Solar Based Hydroponic System
description: The system aims to develop and promote an innovative solar-based hydroponic system that integrates solar energy with modern greenhouse technology and mobile application support.

name: Grant of Subsidy for Purchase of 'Electric Vehicles' to Consumers in State of Goa
description: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of a subsidy for the purchase or conversion of Electric two-wheelers, three-wheelers, and four-wheelers, along with scrapping incentives for old vehicles, incentives for local manufacturing in Goa, and low-cost loans provided by CESL.

name: Flower Development (Demonstration)
description: The scheme aims to promote flower cultivation through demonstrations of major flowers like rose, tuberose, and marigold by providing financial assistance to farmers.

name: Grant of Subsidy for Purchase of 'Electric Vehicles' to Consumers in State of Goa
description: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of a subsidy for the purchase or conversion of Electric two-wheelers, three-wheelers, and four-wheelers, along with scrapping incentives for old vehicles, incentives for local manufacturing in Goa, and low-cost loans provided by CESL.

name: Skill Development Programme- Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to enhance the employability and entrepreneurial skills of students, researchers, and farmers in the field of biotechnology, thereby promoting self-employment and entrepreneurship in emerging areas of the biotechnology sector.

name: Solar Based Hydroponic System
description: The system aims to develop and promote an innovative solar-based hydroponic system that integrates solar energy with modern greenhouse technology and mobile application support.

name: Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide crop insurance protection to farmers against weather-related risks under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana. It ensures financial support to farmers affected by adverse weather conditions.

name: Information-Monitoring, Evaluation, and Social Audit (I-MESA): Social Audit
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The scheme aims to ensure transparency and accountability in the implementation of schemes. It provides a process for accumulating and analyzing beneficiary feedback for scheme improvement, ensuring people's participation, and offering a platform for timely grievance redressal for right holders.

name: State Government Health Scheme (Golden Card)
description: The scheme aims to provide quality healthcare facilities to all government employees, pensioners, and their dependents in Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, prescribed medical treatment is provided free of cost.

name: Awas Sahayta Yojana for 100% Hearing and Visually Impaired Disabled Students in Special Trades of Industrial Training Institutes
description: The scheme aims to ensure qualitative admission and enable 100% hearing and visually impaired students to obtain high-quality technical education free from economic constraints. It provides housing assistance and expenses for food and accommodation, up to ₹4,000/- to PwD Students.

name: Monthly Pension for the Maintenance of the Parents of the Martyred Soldier of the Army
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹10,000 per month to the dependent parents of martyred soldiers for their maintenance and livelihood.

name: Kishor Swasthya Paramarsh Clinic - Uttarakhand
description: This initiative aims to promote the physical, mental, and emotional well-being of adolescents aged 10 to 19 years by providing free health counselling and guidance.

name: Hemoglobinopathy - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to provide comprehensive care, support, and treatment to patients suffering from Thalassemia and Hemophilia in Uttarakhand.

name: State Government Health Scheme (Golden Card)
description: The scheme aims to provide quality healthcare facilities to all government employees, pensioners, and their dependents in Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, prescribed medical treatment is provided free of cost.

name: Annapurna Scheme: Seed Multiplication Programme
description: The scheme aims to enhance the economic status and productivity of SC/ST farmers by providing high-quality Breeder or Certified I grade seeds for seed production. Beneficiaries receive a 75% subsidy on the cost of the seed for up to 1 hectare of land.

name: Scheme for Promotion of Protected Cultivation of Commercial Horticultural Crops
description: The scheme aims to promote the protected cultivation of commercial horticultural crops by providing financial assistance to farmers. The scheme supports greenhouse, shade net, low tunnel, plastic mulching, bird/hail net, and cultivation of vegetables and flowers under polyhouse/shade net house.

name: Own Transformer Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide permanent irrigation pump connections to farmers quickly by allowing them to install their own transformers.

name: Police Internship Scheme
description: The scheme aims to familiarize meritorious students with police functioning and promote research in law enforcement by providing selected students a six-week internship in district police stations under official supervision.

name: Integrated Vegetable Development Program
description: The scheme aims to increase vegetable production in all district headquarters and within a 20 km radius of industrial establishments in Madhya Pradesh through integrated vegetable development.

name: Awas Sahayta Yojana for 100% Hearing and Visually Impaired Disabled Students in Special Trades of Industrial Training Institutes
description: The scheme aims to ensure qualitative admission and enable 100% hearing and visually impaired students to obtain high-quality technical education free from economic constraints. It provides housing assistance and expenses for food and accommodation, up to ₹4,000/- to PwD Students.

name: Gomantak Govsamvardhan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to support the conservation and rearing of Local Breeds of Cattle in the State of Goa. It provides financial assistance of ₹80/- per animal per day to Dairy Farmers or Individuals who are bonafide residents of Goa to encourage responsible stall feeding and conservation practices.

name: Mukhyamantri Gramin Street Vendor Rin Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide working capital or low-cost equipment as a loan through banks to support businesses. It benefits poor-class migrant workers and small traders (Street Vendors) in rural areas of Madhya Pradesh, also offering necessary Entrepreneurship Development Programme (EDP) training.

name: National Bio Energy Programme - Uttarakhand Renewable Energy Development Agency
description: The scheme aims to promote the use of biogas as a clean and renewable energy source, help livestock farmers set up biogas plants, reduce the use of conventional fuels, and support eco-friendly rural development in the state.

name: Mukhyamantri Saur Swarojgar Yojana - Uttarakhand Renewable Energy Development Agency
description: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among the residents of Uttarakhand by enabling them to establish and operate solar power projects, thereby generating clean energy, providing a sustainable source of income, and encouraging entrepreneurship.

name: Grid Connected Rooftop Scheme (Phase-II) - Uttarakhand Renewable Energy Development Agency
description: The scheme aims to promote the installation of rooftop solar systems among domestic households, group housing societies, and residential welfare associations in Uttarakhand, enabling consumers to reduce their electricity bills, earn income by feeding surplus power into the grid.

name: Interest Free Loan Scheme To Teachers For The Purchase Of Laptops
description: The scheme aims to enhance the quality of teaching in schools in the State of Goa by equipping teachers with necessary Information Technology knowledge and skills. It offers an Interest Free Loan up to a maximum of ₹1,00,000/- for purchasing a Laptop to regular/permanent, full-time teachers.

name: Scheme for Giving Stipend to the Trainees Belonging to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Community Enrolled under Various Labour Welfare Centres in the State of Goa
description: The scheme aims to give benefits under the Scheduled Caste Sub-Plan and Tribal Sub-Plan to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe trainees enrolled under various Labour Welfare Centres in the State of Goa. Eligible trainees receive a monthly stipend of ₹1,000/- to support their training in crafts.

name: State Award To Two Anganwadi Workers Under Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) Schemes
description: The scheme recognizes Anganwadi Workers under the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) Schemes for their exemplary performance in improving the quality and coverage of services provided to children and mothers. Each awardee receives a cash award of ₹5,000/- and a citation.

name: Simplification of Sale Process of Herbal Products - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to simplify the sale process of medicinal and aromatic products produced by cultivators, enabling them to legally and easily sell their produce through authorized markets or buyers.
tags: ['Cultivator Of Aromatic Plants', 'Cultivator Of Medicinal Plants', 'Herbal Products', 'Herbs', 'Marketing', 'Sale Process']

name: Sugarcane Seed Replacement Programme / Production Enhancement Scheme
description: The scheme aims to increase sugarcane productivity & improve sugar recovery by promoting cultivation of high-quality, high-yielding, & newly developed sugarcane varieties, while providing farmers with financial support, modern cultivation techniques, & access to advanced agricultural technology.

name: Stamp Duty Exemption for Property Registration
description: The scheme aims to provide financial relief during property registration by offering exemptions or rebates in stamp duty to specific sections of society.

name: Chief Minister’s Award for Excellence in Public Administration
description: The scheme aims to recognize and reward innovative and extraordinary work done by a team of officials to encourage good governance, high standards of services, and replication of best practices. It recognizes outstanding and exemplary performance by a team of officials with a scroll and cash award.

name: Cultivation of Aromatic Plants under MGNREGA - Centre for Aromatic Plants
description: The scheme aims to encourage farmers in rural areas to grow aromatic plants by providing them free planting material, technical help, and wage support through MGNREGA.

name: Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship
description: The scheme aims to provide stipend and financial assistance to students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. The benefits include financial assistance and stipends for poor students from Class 9th up to normal Three Years Degree Courses (e.g. Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Science, etc.

name: Interest Subsidy Scheme, 2017
description: The scheme aims to incentivize units for making their enterprises financially viable. It provides interest subsidy on term loan and/or working capital loan (up to ₹25,00,000/- per year, or ₹27,50,000/- for women/Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe applicants) to eligible industries.

name: Incentives to Green Investment Scheme
description: The scheme aims to incentivize investments by existing and new units in environmentally friendly initiatives. It provides financial support through reimbursement for Water and Energy Audits and Capital Reimbursement for Energy Conservation Equipment to eligible manufacturing units.

name: Shooting Permission Certificate
description: The scheme aims to simplify the process of granting official permission for film shooting in Uttarakhand through a single-window online system, ensuring timely approvals and promoting the state as a film-friendly destination.

name: Scheme for Fencing in Gardens
description: The scheme aims to protect fruit plants, horticultural crops, and orchards from wild animals by providing financial assistance for fencing.

name: Bee Keeping
description: The scheme aims to promote beekeeping as a sustainable livelihood by providing subsidized bee boxes, bee colonies, and training support to farmers, thereby increasing honey production, enhancing farm income, and strengthening the beekeeping sector in Uttarakhand.

name: Financial Assistance for Higher Studies
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. This assistance supports students pursuing higher education like MBBS, MBA, and Engineering, including studies within and outside the State or Country.

name: Coaching For Higher Studies
description: The scheme aims to provide coaching to students of Tea Tribes and Adivasi community for preparing them for various competitive examinations like Civil Services, Medical, Engineering, Staff Selection Committee (Graduate level), Banking (Probationary Officers), etc.

name: The Goa Archaeological Research Fellowship Scheme
description: The scheme aims to encourage scholars to undertake research activities in the field of Archaeology of Goa and West Coast based on primary archaeological sources. It offers financial fellowship assistance of up to ₹40,000/- per month to eligible Post-Graduate or PhD scholars for 24 months.

name: Mushroom Production
description: The scheme aims to promote and support mushroom cultivation in the state by providing financial assistance and subsidies for establishing mushroom, compost, and spawn production units, thereby enhancing both farmer income and overall mushroom production in Uttarakhand.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana - Gramin, Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to provide pucca houses with basic amenities to eligible rural households in Uttarakhand, ensuring dignified living conditions for economically and socially disadvantaged families.

name: The Goa Archaeological Research Fellowship Scheme
description: The scheme aims to encourage scholars to undertake research activities in the field of Archaeology of Goa and West Coast based on primary archaeological sources. It offers financial fellowship assistance of up to ₹40,000/- per month to eligible Post-Graduate or PhD scholars for 24 months.

name: Scheme For Women Entrepreneurs Mahila Udyam Nidhi (MUN)
description: The scheme aims to meet the equity gap for new Small Scale Industrial units and service activities promoted by women entrepreneurs. It offers Term Loans and Seed Capital for projects costing up to ₹10,00,000/-.

name: Inter-Caste / Inter-Religious Marriage Award
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to married couples where, in the case of an inter-caste marriage, one spouse belongs to a Scheduled Caste, and in the case of an inter-religious marriage, both spouses belong to different religions.

name: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Degree)
description: Saksham is a Scholarship Scheme by the Ministry of Education, implemented by AICTE, aimed at providing encouragement and support to specially-abled children to pursue technical education. This is an attempt to give every young specially-abled student the opportunity to study further.

name: Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres Scheme
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: A welfare scheme by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare was launched in 2002. AC&ABC aims at agricultural development, supplementing the efforts of public extension by providing extension and other services to farmers either on a payment basis or free of cost as per the business model.

name: Agnipath Yojana
description: A welfare scheme by the Department of Military Affairs, MoD under which rigorous military training will be imparted to the youth aged between 17.5 to 23 years and meeting other educational, physical, and medical criteria, who are aspirational to be a part of the armed forces.

name: Centrally-Sponsored Scheme Of Pre-Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste Students Studying In Classes 9th & 10th
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students from Scheduled Castes studying in Class 9th and 10th in a Govt. School / a School recognized by Govt. / CBSE / State Board of Secondary Education.

name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) studying in class 9th and class 10th in a government school or a school recognized by the government or CBSE or State Board. This includes persons with visual, hearing, speech, loco-motor, mental retardation & other disabilities.

state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment for regular, full-time students from Scheduled Castes studying in Class 9th and 10th in a Govt. School / a School recognized by Govt. / CBSE / State Board of Secondary Education.

name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) studying in class 9th and class 10th in a government school or a school recognized by the government or CBSE or State Board. name: Mahila Samriddhi Yojana
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: This is a micro-financing programme aiming towards the empowerment of women from underprivileged backgrounds or economically backward areas. Through this scheme, these women can apply for a loan at a nominal interest rate to fulfil their dreams and goals and gain financial independence.

name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme
description: A non-contributory pension scheme to provide social security to Divyangjans aged 18 and above who belong to a poor family (BPL) in society.

name: CBSE Merit Scholarship Scheme For Single Girl Child
description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education for meritorious Single Girl Students, who are the only child of their parents; and have passed the CBSE Class 10th Examination with 60% or more marks and are continuing their further school education of Class 11th and 12th.

name: HIMAYAT- Deen Dayal Upadhyaya-Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
description: HIMAYAT is a placement-linked placement-linked market-driven skill training program by the Ministry of Rural Development for the unemployed youth of J&K. The scheme aims at providing entrepreneurial skills for sustainable livelihood to 30,000 youth of J&K and facilitating access to finance.

name: Senior Citizens Saving Scheme
description: Introduced in 2004 by the Govt. of India, SCSS offers a steady stream of income for individuals over 60 years old. As it is a government-backed scheme, there is minimal risk associated with SCSS. Individuals can apply for this scheme in post offices and public and private banks.

name: National Fellowship For OBC Students
description: "National Fellowship for OBC Students" was launched by the University Grants Commission (UGC) during the financial year 2014-15 to increase the opportunities for the students of Other Backward Classes (OBCs) to pursue higher education leading to acquiring degrees such as M.Phil. and Ph.D.

name: Junior Research Fellowship In Engineering & Technology
description: The scheme "Junior Research Fellowship in Engineering & Technology" by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education is meant for candidates who wish to pursue research leading to a Ph.D. degree in engineering and technology.

name: National Talent Scholarship Postgraduate
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: Merit based support through National Talent Scholarship to the Under-graduates and Post graduate students seeking admission in Agricultural Universities in a State other than the State of their domicile, through ICAR All India Entrance Examination (AIEE).

name: National Talent Scholarship Postgraduate
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: Merit based support through National Talent Scholarship to the Under-graduates and Post graduate students seeking admission in Agricultural Universities in a State other than the State of their domicile, through ICAR All India Entrance Examination (AIEE).

name: ICAR - Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: The scheme "Post-Matric Scholarship to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes Candidates" was introduced by ICAR, Dept. of Agricultural Research and Education, to enable the students belonging to the weaker sections of society to complete undergraduate courses.

name: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) - Faculty Fellowship
description: The "INSPIRE FACULTY FELLOWSHIP" component provides opportunities to 100 persons every year with Ph.D. qualifications in the age group of 27-32 years for 5 years to carry out research in both basic and applied science areas including engineering, medicine, agriculture, and veterinary sciences.

name: Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship
description: The scheme "Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship" is a fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education (DoHE). Post-doctoral research is an important enabling step in grooming young researchers for launching an academic/research career.

name: AICTE-Swanath Scholarship Scheme For Students
description: A scholarship scheme by the Student Development Cell (StDC) of All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to provide encouragement and support to orphans, wards of parents who died due to Covid-19, wards of Armed Forces, and Central Paramilitary Forces martyred in action (Shaheed).

name: Akanksha Housing Scheme
description: Akanksha Housing Scheme was launched by the Housing Department, Government of West Bengal on 28/02/2014 to provide housing to the serving State Government employees.

name: Banishree Scholarship
description: "Banishree Scholarship" Scheme was introduced by the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Odisha with the aim to assist and encourage them to study as well acquire technical/ professional/ vocational training.

name: Madhu Babu Pension Yojana
