name: Microcredit Finance Scheme- Self Help Groups (DAADC)
description: The scheme aims to promote self-employment for SC individuals. It offers microloans to start small businesses and become economically self-sufficient.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Large RAS Culture System Gujarat
description: The scheme provides financial assistance for various inland fisheries activities, including the establishment of large Recirculating Aquaculture Systems (RAS), and is provided to individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir leaseholders, and private entities.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Medium RAS Culture System Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to enhance fish production and create employment through sustainable inland fisheries. It provides financial support to eligible beneficiaries for setting up medium-scale RAS units.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Back-Yard Mini RAS Unit Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to enhance inland fish production and create employment. It provides subsidies to eligible beneficiaries for fish hatchery and RAS unit establishment.

name: Sub mission on Seeds and Planting Material
description: The scheme aims to increase the production of certified/quality seed; strengthen Seed Testing Laboratories; assist Seed Producing Institutes for the adoption of new technologies, ensuring farmers get quality seeds at the right time and reasonable prices.

name: Mission for Integrated Horticulture Development (MIDH)
description: The scheme "Mission for Integrated Horticulture Development (MIDH)" is a centrally sponsored scheme that aims to promote growth in the horticulture sector through financial and technical support to farmers for cultivation, post-harvest management, and market linkage development.

name: Parivahan Scheme (GBCDC)
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for vehicle purchases in the transport sector for SEBC unemployed individuals. A loan is provided under the scheme.

name: CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide one-time financial assistance to eligible research scholars from public institutions in Assam, promoting academic excellence and innovation. It provides ₹25,000/- to research scholars and ₹40,000/- to Divyang research scholars.

name: Provide Assistance to Farmers Bringing Goods to Market Committees for Cost of Goods Transportation (Tribal)
description: The scheme "Provide Assistance to Farmers Bringing Goods to Market Committees for Cost of Goods Transportation (Tribal)" aims to encourage tribal farmers to bring their produce to market committees by providing financial assistance towards transportation costs.

name: Handloom Rebate Scheme
description: The scheme provides 10% special rebate for 120 festival days; Additional 5-15% permanent rebates for regular sales; Enhanced 20% rebates for women-led cooperatives. The scheme aims to enhance market competitiveness for Gujarat's handloom cooperatives and apex societies.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Inputs for Freshwater Aquaculture - Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to increase inland fish production and employment through reservoir-based fish farming. The scheme offers financial assistance to individuals and groups via the iKhedut portal.

name: Assistance to Co-operative Irrigation Societies (Trible Area)
description: The scheme "Assistance to Co-operative Irrigation Societies (Tribal Area)" aims to enhance agricultural productivity by financially supporting co-operative irrigation societies in tribal areas through the installation of water distribution infrastructure.

name: Kasturba Gandhi Residential Girls’ Hostel
description: The scheme aims to encourage girls’ participation in education at the upper primary and secondary levels and to provide quality education to girls from disadvantaged groups (SC, ST, OBC, Minority communities and BPL families) studying in Classes 6 to 12.

name: Vocational Education Programme
description: The scheme aims to impart vocational education alongside academic learning to students of classes 9 to 12 in selected government secondary schools. Vocational education is offered in 08 sectors approved by the Government of India under the NSQF framework.

name: AGR-4 Scheduled Castes Sub-Plan for Distribution of Seeds and Fertilizers Input Kits at Subsidised Rates to Scheduled Caste Cultivators
description: The scheme aims to provide subsidised seeds, fertilizers, and organic inputs to Scheduled Caste farmers to improve agricultural productivity.

name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: 100% Soluble Chemical Fertilizer/Nano Fertilizer Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to help Adivasi farmers and tribal cultivators increase crop production and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided for various agricultural inputs and equipment such as seeds, fertilizers, plant protection equipment, and pump sets.

name: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Plant protection pesticides Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to help Scheduled Tribe farmers and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas achieve higher agricultural crop production and improve their livelihood. Through this scheme, various tools and practices are provided to the farmers at subsidised rates.

name: Procedure for Making "Orphan Certificate" for Getting Horizontal Reservation for Orphan Children
description: This certificate provides 5% horizontal reservation in Government/Non-Government services for affected children, including those whose both biological or adoptive parents have died within 21 years from the child’s birth. orphan children residing in voluntary or government-run homes within the state.

name: National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)
description: The scheme "National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme that aims to promote organic farming practices through providing financial assistance for organic inputs and infrastructure support to farmers.

name: Whale Shark Conservation Programme
description: The scheme aims to protect the endangered Whale Shark, the world's largest fish, along the Gujarat coast, a crucial breeding site. It mitigates threats from fishing by providing compensation for damaged nets and cultivates a strong conservation ethic among local fishermen and the broader public.

name: Assistance for Establishment of On farm Storage for Sorting-Grading
description: The scheme "Assistance for Establishment of On-Farm Storage for Sorting-Grading" aims to prevent post-harvest spoilage in horticultural crops by providing financial assistance for constructing storage infrastructure and purchasing sorting-grading equipment for farmers across the state.

name: Assistance for Area Expansion of Vegetable Crops through Hybrid Seed
description: The scheme "Assistance for Area Expansion of Vegetable Crops through Hybrid Seed" aims to promote natural farming and hybrid seed cultivation through financial assistance to farmers. The scheme provides up to ₹20,000 per hectare to encourage sustainable agricultural practices.

name: National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)
description: The scheme "National Mission For Sustainable Agriculture-Parmparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (NMSA-PKVY)" is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme that aims to promote organic farming practices through providing financial assistance for organic inputs and infrastructure support to farmers.

name: Whale Shark Conservation Programme
description: The scheme aims to protect the endangered Whale Shark, the world's largest fish, along the Gujarat coast, a crucial breeding site. It mitigates threats from fishing by providing compensation for damaged nets and cultivates a strong conservation ethic among local fishermen and the broader public.

name: NAMO Shree Scheme
description: The scheme aims to ensure proper nutritional support to pregnant women and lactating mothers and encourage institutional deliveries. It provides financial assistance of ₹12,000/- to eligible women beneficiaries covering expenses from conception to delivery.

name: Scholarships to Meritorious Students of Sanskrit Schools
description: The scheme aims to promote Sanskrit education by providing scholarships to meritorious students of Prathmik Madhyama (Class 10) and Uttar Madhyama (Class 12) in Sanskrit schools who secure the highest marks.

name: Silicosis Financial Assistance Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to heirs of workers engaged in Akik occupation who died due to silicosis disease. It benefits the families of deceased workers with monetary compensation of ₹1,00,000/- as support for occupational disease-related deaths.

name: Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni
description: The scheme aims to support ten lakh girl students with financial grants as admission incentives for Higher Secondary, Graduation, and Post-Graduation studies to eradicate child marriage. It benefits unmarried girl students domiciled in Assam with monthly financial assistance.

name: Sanskrit Chhaatr Pratiyogita
description: The scheme aims to promote Sanskrit education among students by organizing Sanskrit competitions at various levels. Under this scheme, Sanskrit competitions are organized at various levels for both junior (Class 6 to 10) and senior (Class 11 to post-graduation) categories.

name: Swanath Scholarship Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide financial support to diploma and graduate-level students who are orphans, whose parents or either parent has died due to COVID-19, or who are dependents of martyrs from the military or central armed forces.

name: Dastkar Prashikshan (I.T.I)
description: The scheme aims to provide benefits to the youth of the state by connecting them with private-sector employment or self-employment opportunities through skills training offered at district ITIs.

name: Project Sankalp
description: The scheme aims to provide industry-led vocational skilling to enhance youth employability and meet industry demand for skilled manpower. It offers sector-specific training, apprenticeship, and employment opportunities, benefiting youth with better job prospects.

name: Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loan
description: The scheme "Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loan" by the Education Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to students by offering 100% interest subsidy on education loans.

name: Mukhyamantri Gyansetu Merit Scholarship Yojana
description: This scheme introduced by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to support meritorious students by providing scholarships from Class 6th to Class 12th in selected schools.

name: Subsidy for Battery Operated 2-Wheelers
description: This scheme is introduced by the Climate Change Department, Gujarat, aims to promote renewable energy and clean transportation by providing a subsidy to students for the purchase of battery-operated two-wheelers from authorized manufacturers.

name: Subsidy For Battery Operated Three-Wheelers
description: This scheme is introduced by the Climate Change Department, Gujarat, aims to promote the adoption of eco-friendly vehicles by providing a subsidy on the purchase of battery-operated three-wheelers.

name: Labour Card and Renewal of Labour Card
description: Under  this facilities, a labour card is issued to workers engaged in construction, repair, maintenance, and related activities, enabling them to avail the benefits of all welfare schemes provided by the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare

name: Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services
description: The scheme aims to provide job opportunities to medal-winning sportspersons of Uttarakhand, who have represented the state in international and national games, by offering them out-of-turn employment in various state services.

name: Namo Laxmi Yojana
description: The scheme "Namo Laxmi Yojana" by the Education Department, aims to reduce the dropout rate of girls in secondary and higher secondary education by providing financial assistance for completing studies from Class 9th to 12th.

name: Research Assistantship
description: The scheme aims to provide research assistantship to undergraduate and postgraduate research scholars to support their academic and research activities.

name: Super-100 Programme - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to identify and support the brightest Class 12 Science stream students by providing them with high-quality coaching and guidance for engineering and medical entrance examinations. The programme is a unique state-level initiative approved by the Government of India.

name: Training Program for A-HELP Women Workers - Uttarakhand Livestock Development Board
description: The scheme aims to provide community-service-based skill development and employment opportunities for women in the field of animal husbandry. Eligible women members of Self-Help Groups under the Uttarakhand State Rural Livelihood Mission can apply.

name: National Livestock Mission: Entrepreneurship Development Scheme - Uttarakhand Livestock Development Board
description: The scheme aims to promote employment generation through entrepreneurship development in the small ruminants, poultry, piggery, and the fodder sectors by providing financial and institutional support to individuals and organized groups under the National Livestock Mission.

name: Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreography & Dancing
description: The scheme aims to promote Konkani songs by presenting them with choreography and dancing to attract youth towards Konkani cultural performances. It provides cash prizes, mementos, certificates and traveling allowances to participating groups in organized competitions.

name: High Altitude Guide Course
description: The scheme aims to train and certify youth of Uttarakhand as professional high-altitude guides who have already completed a Low Altitude Guide Course from a recognized institution.

name: Training Program for A-HELP Women Workers - Uttarakhand Livestock Development Board
description: The scheme aims to provide community-service-based skill development and employment opportunities for women in the field of animal husbandry. Eligible women members of Self-Help Groups under the Uttarakhand State Rural Livelihood Mission can apply.

name: National Livestock Mission: Entrepreneurship Development Scheme - Uttarakhand Livestock Development Board
description: The scheme aims to promote employment generation through entrepreneurship development in the small ruminants, poultry, piggery, and the fodder sectors by providing financial and institutional support to individuals and organized groups under the National Livestock Mission.

name: Research Assistantship
description: The scheme aims to provide research assistantship to undergraduate and postgraduate research scholars to support their academic and research activities.

name: Conducting Outreach Programmes in Various Fields
description: It aims to promote scientific awareness among students, teachers, and the general public by conducting outreach programmes and activities in various fields of science through both online and offline modes, thereby making science education and research more accessible across the state.

name: Information, Monitoring, Evaluation and Social Audit (I-MESA): Evaluation and Studies
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The "Evaluation and Studies" component of the scheme aims to establish institutionalized mechanisms for achieving transparency and accountability, generating lessons learned for real-time program improvement, and ensuring effective knowledge dissemination among stakeholders and targeted beneficiary.

name: Super-100 Programme - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to identify and support the brightest Class 12 Science stream students by providing them with high-quality coaching and guidance for engineering and medical entrance examinations. The programme is a unique state-level initiative approved by the Government of India.

name: Organization of Multi-Purpose Camps/ Public Awareness Camps/ Medical Camps/Legal Service Camps
description: The scheme aims to organize camps & awareness programs across urban & rural areas to inform and empower vulnerable groups such as women, children, senior citizens, workers in the unorganized sector, persons with disabilities, acid attack survivors & victims of trafficking about their legal rights.
tags: ['Legal Rights', 'Legal Service Camp', 'Medical Camp', 'Multi-Purpose Camp', 'Public Awareness Camp']

name: Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Award Scheme To Successful Candidates for Central and All India Service Examination
description: The scheme aims to encourage educated youth among the citizens of India and bonafide residents of Mizoram who aspire to succeed entry to Central and All India Services, addressing the issue of Mizo educated youths lagging behind and becoming increasingly marginalized in examinations.

name: Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kantaram)
description: The scheme aims to encourage producers, lyricists, singers, and musicians to produce qualitative Konkani Audio/Video/Digital albums of Tiatr songs. Cash awards from ₹5,000/- to ₹30,000/- are provided across twelve categories to Goan artists producing Konkani kantaram albums.

name: Margadeepam Scholarship
description: The scheme aims to provide educational financial support to minority community students in Kerala. It offers ₹1,500/- annual scholarship to eligible students from Class 1st to Class 8th studying in government and government-aided schools.

name: Financial Assistance To Dairy Farmers Belonging To Scheduled Tribes And Scheduled Caste For Purchase Of Basic Dairy Equipments
description: The scheme aims to provide assistance to the Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Caste communities for the purchase of basic dairy equipments needed to run a small scale dairy farming, and to encourage the tribal population to adopt Animal Husbandry activities, especially Dairy Development Schemes.

name: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Boys Residential Hostel Scheme (Classes 1 to 8)
description: In Madhya Pradesh, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Residential School Scheme for Boys (Class 1-8) Introduce by the School Education Department. It aims to ensure primary education and reduce the gender gap in education. Free residence, food, clothing, books, uniforms, and medical care are provided.

name: Mukhyamantri Dairy Animal Distribution Programme (Special Backward Tribes Baiga, Bharia & Sahariya)
description: The scheme aims to improve the livelihood and nutritional security of tribal communities by providing two dairy animals at a 90% subsidy to eligible tribal livestock farmers.

name: Scheduled Caste Sub Plan (SCSP): Electrification of Wells of Scheduled Caste Farmers
description: The scheme aims to provide agricultural electricity connections on a priority basis to Scheduled Caste farmers. Benefits include electrification of wells and free domestic electricity connections for Scheduled Caste farmers and beneficiaries across Gujarat.

name: Loan For Foreign Study (S.E.B.C.)
description: The scheme aims to support higher education abroad for eligible students from the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC). It provides a maximum Foreign Study Loan of ₹15,00,000/- at an annual interest rate of 4% to SEBC students.

name: Establishment of Digital Learning Platform
description: The scheme aims to establish Digital Learning Platform to provide training and career counseling on various subjects, including ICT orientation, emerging technologies, and more, through both online and offline modes for students of secondary schools across the state.

name: Yatra Anudan
description: The scheme aims to support researchers and scientists in attending international scientific workshops and other programs by providing eligible applicants with travel grants covering up to 50% of the expenses (maximum ₹25,000/-).

name: Tour Program of Modern Laboratories
description: The scheme aims to promote biotechnology education and research by providing students, researchers, and farmers with exposure to modern laboratories, advanced research activities, and innovative technologies.

name: Nandi Shala Yojana
description: The scheme aims to improve local cattle breeds through natural insemination. Under this, indigenous breeding bulls are provided on subsidy to livestock farmers in rural Gram Panchayats.

name: Seemant Parvatiya Janpad Baal Vigyan Mahotsav
description: It aims to provide students from classes 6 to 12 of government/non-government schools in six border districts of the state (Uttarkashi, Chamoli, Rudraprayag, Champawat, Bageshwar,Pithoragarh) with an opportunity to participate in science competitions & to promote scientific awareness in these areas.

name: Development of Manures & Fertilizers: Assistance for use of Soil Conditioner
description: The scheme aims to amend the soil based on soil test reports, address pH and nutrient deficiencies in fertilization practices, and address important soil deficiencies like micronutrients that affect crop productivity. The payment of the sanctioned subsidy is through the Electronic Clearance System.

name: Yatra Anudan
description: The scheme aims to support researchers and scientists in attending international scientific workshops and other programs by providing eligible applicants with travel grants covering up to 50% of the expenses (maximum ₹25,000/-).

name: 100% Penalty Mafi Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide financial relief to beneficiaries of the Gujarat Housing Board and Slum Clearance Cell who have pending installment dues by offering a complete waiver of penalty amounts. It benefits tenants and property allottees by waiving 100% penalties on arrears if paid by 31st March.

name: Dr. V.N. Mathur Award (M.Sc. Mathematics)
description: The scheme aims to provide financial support and encourage meritorious students pursuing an M.Sc. in Mathematics, thereby assisting them and reducing their financial burden. The assistance of ₹20,000/- per year is provided to eligible students.

name: Namami Gange Yojana- Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable and organic farming practices among farmers residing in villages along the banks of the Ganga and its tributaries.

name: Allotment of Commercial Shops
description: The scheme aims to promote ease of doing business for licensed traders by providing them with well-located commercial shops in market yards (mandis).

name: Allotment of Canteens
description: The scheme aims to promote trade and entrepreneurship by allotting canteens for selling tea and other food items to eligible residents of Uttarakhand through a fair and transparent tender process.

name: Madhya Pradesh Fasal Vividhikaran (Crop Diversification) Encouragement Scheme
description: The scheme aims to encourage crop diversification by providing necessary inputs to farmers who shift from growing wheat and paddy. Benefits are provided primarily to the implementing Company, Firm, or Institution to cover costs related to Human Resources and Marketing, benefiting farmers.

name: Goa State Logistics and Warehousing Incentives Scheme: Subsidy on Electricity Duty
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for the development of the logistics and warehousing industry in the State. This component offers a 100% annual reimbursement of electricity duty, up to a maximum of ₹5,00,000/-, to eligible Cold Chain Units.

name: Goa State Logistics And Warehousing Incentives Scheme: Subsidy on Stamp Duty and Registration Charges
description: The scheme provides financial assistance by reimbursing Stamp Duty and Registration Charges paid by prospective developers engaged in the establishment of Logistics and Warehousing projects. The scheme provides 100% reimbursement, capped at ₹10,00,000/- for Stamp Duty.

name: Allotment of Commercial Shops
description: The scheme aims to promote ease of doing business for licensed traders by providing them with well-located commercial shops in market yards (mandis).

name: Allotment of Canteens
description: The scheme aims to promote trade and entrepreneurship by allotting canteens for selling tea and other food items to eligible residents of Uttarakhand through a fair and transparent tender process.

name: Mukhya Mantri Krishak Samriddhi Yojana
description: The scheme aims to incentivize farmers for improving production and quality of specific Rabi and Kharif crops by providing an incentive payment over and above the Minimum Support Price received. It provides varying financial incentives per quintal to registered farmers selling wheat, paddy, etc.

name: Deendayal Upadhyay Gram Jyoti Yojana
description: The scheme aims to strengthen the rural power infrastructure by implementing feeder separation, metering, distribution system strengthening, and rural electrification works.

name: Weekly Iron Folic Acid Tablets Free Distribution - Uttarakhand
description: This aims to improve the health and nutritional status of school-going children by preventing and reducing iron deficiency anemia. Under this scheme, teachers distribute free iron and folic acid tablets every Monday to all students enrolled in government & government-aided schools across the state.

name: Rural Business Incubators - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to promote entrepreneurship and develop a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem in the state by providing aspiring and existing entrepreneurs with technical, business, legal, marketing, and mentorship support.

name: Haj Pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia
description: The scheme aims to perform Haj Pilgrimage at Holy Mecca. The scheme provides an air fare subsidy of ₹24,000/- for each pilgrim and includes free medical facility while in Mecca. The applicant must be an Indian citizen who possesses sound health and has not performed Haj for the preceding five years.

name: Uttarakhand Oon Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote traditional wool spinning and weaving activities in the state while providing sustainable employment opportunities to local artisans and weavers.

name: Madhya Pradesh Fasal Vividhikaran (Crop Diversification) Encouragement Scheme
description: The scheme aims to encourage crop diversification by providing necessary inputs to farmers who shift from growing wheat and paddy. Benefits are provided primarily to the implementing Company, Firm, or Institution to cover costs related to Human Resources and Marketing, benefiting farmers.

name: Education Loan Scheme of NMDFC
description: Loan of upto Rs. 20 lacs for domestic courses & Rs. 30 lacs for courses abroad under Credit  Line-1 and Credit line -2 is extended to beneficiaries belong to minority communities at 3% p.a. & 8% p.a respectively.

name: Education Loan Scheme of NMDFC
description: Loan of upto Rs. 20 lacs for domestic courses & Rs. 30 lacs for courses abroad under Credit  Line-1 and Credit line -2 is extended to beneficiaries belong to minority communities at 3% p.a. & 8% p.a respectively.

name: Uttarakhand Oon Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote traditional wool spinning and weaving activities in the state while providing sustainable employment opportunities to local artisans and weavers.

name: Nashamukt Gram Panchayat Puraskar Yojana
description: The scheme aims to incentivize and recognize Gram Panchayats that demonstrate outstanding work towards de-addiction, ensuring 100% of their population lives a drug-free life. The scheme provides the benefit of a cash award of ₹1,00,000/- and a Certificate of Appreciation to Gram Panchayat.

name: Award Scheme to Encourage Entrepreneurs - Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to recognize exceptional craftsmanship among registered artisans and weavers in Uttarakhand by encouraging innovation, creativity, and excellence in the handicrafts and handloom sectors through state and district-level awards.

name: Procedure for Making Medical Certificate (for Certifying Disability)
description: The certificate aims to ensure that persons with disabilities can easily obtain authentic medical certification required to avail benefits under various social welfare schemes, including disability pensions, scholarships, healthcare facilities, and employment reservations.

name: Tribals Development Plan: Purchase of Tourist Taxi
description: This sub-scheme aims to empower Scheduled Tribe (ST) families by providing financial assistance to purchase tourist taxis for self-employment in Goa’s growing tourism industry. It supports tribal households in transitioning from traditional occupations to sustainable livelihood opportunities.

name: Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pariyojana - Veer Chandra Singh Garhwali Uttarakhand University of Horticulture and Forestry
description: The scheme aims to conduct research and improve important horticultural and forestry species, conserve their germplasm, provide improved seeds and saplings, and train farmers in using better techniques to enhance productivity.

name: Lakhpati Didi Yojana - Uttarakhand
description: The primary objective of the scheme is to improve the economic status of women in Uttarakhand by empowering them to become financially self-reliant and achieve the status of “Lakhpati Didis.”

name: Grants-in-aid and Monthly Grants to Soldiers Decorated With Gallantry Decorations
description: The scheme provides a grant of ₹20,00,000–₹12,000 and a monthly allowance of ₹5,000–₹1,500 to gallantry awardees as a mark of honor and recognition for their valor.

name: Financial Assistance for Natural Disaster
description: The scheme aims to provide timely financial assistance and relief to individuals and families affected by natural calamities, helping them recover from losses to life, property, and livelihood.

name: Distribution of Materials to Promote Herbal Cultivation in Uttarakhand - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: Under this scheme, there is a special provision for the free distribution of seeds or saplings of medicinal plants up to 3 nali and seeds or saplings of aromatic plants up to 5 nali to farmers belonging to border districts, Scheduled Castes/Tribes, and Below Poverty Line (BPL) categories.

name: Financial Assistance to the Family of Temple Employees
description: The scheme aims to grant financial assistance to the family of the temple employee who expires while in service. The scheme provides an amount of ₹5,000/- under the Group Insurance Scheme and an amount of ₹20,000/- under the Chief Minister’s Welfare Fund. The applications are accepted offline.

name: Promotion of Post-Harvest Management, Processing, and Value Addition of Aromatic Plant Produce to Farmers/Institutions/Groups in the State - Centre for Aromatic Plants
description: The scheme aims to encourage and support farmers, institutions, and groups engaged in aromatic plant cultivation to establish post-harvest management and processing facilities.

name: Quality Test Report - Centre for Aromatic Plants
description: The scheme aims to provide quality testing facilities at a subsidized rate to registered aromatic farmers, enabling them to obtain authentic quality reports for their produce or essential oils.

name: Training Classes In Veda/Devaram
description: The scheme aims to conduct training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham for divine worship/Poojas. It benefits eligible candidates by providing religious training in Saivaite and Vainavaite temples, and provides an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month to the instructing pandits.

name: Bhesaj Krishi Vikas Yojana (Herbal Cultivation Programme)
description: The scheme aims to promote the cultivation of medicinal and herbal plants (Jadi-Buti) among local farmers and unemployed youth, providing sustainable employment and improving their economic well-being.

name: E-Rickshaw Kalyan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among unemployed youth in the state by providing affordable loans for purchase of e-rickshaws, thereby enhancing their livelihoods. Under this scheme, loans are provided to unemployed youth for purchase of e-rickshaws at an annual interest rate of 9%.

name: Motorcycle Taxi Yojana
description: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among the residents of Uttarakhand by providing interest-free loans for purchasing motorcycles or scooters to operate as motorcycle taxis, thereby enhancing tourism connectivity and generating livelihood opportunities in the state.

name: Issuing Legal Production Certificate (LPC) to Producers of Medicinal Plant Products for Export - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to facilitate the lawful export of endangered and CITES-listed medicinal plant species such as Kuth, Kutki, etc. by issuing Legal Production Certificates (LPC) to cultivators who legally grow these species on their own measured land.
tags: ['Export Of Products', 'Herbal Products', 'Herbs', 'Legal Production Certificate', 'Medicinal Plant']

name: Goa (Subsidy to Clay Idol Makers) Scheme
description: The scheme aims to encourage Goan artisans to continue traditional clay idol making by providing a subsidy of ₹100/- per idol, supporting registered local craftsmen in preserving cultural heritage and ensuring livelihood sustainability.

name: Scheme for SSI / MSI Sector (PIPDIC)
description: The scheme aims to extend financial support to establish new, or expand/modernize existing, Small Scale Industry and Medium Scale Industry units. Benefits include term loans up to ₹10,00,00,000/- for fixed asset acquisition.

name: Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM): Self-Employment Programme – Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods and economic empowerment of the urban poor by providing financial support and guidance for establishing self-employment ventures, strengthening their family’s economy, and generating new employment opportunities.

name: Aawasiy Suvidha 1 – Indralok Aawasiy Yojana (Group Housing)
description: The scheme aims to provide residential facilities to homeless families through a registration process and lottery-based allotment.

name: Distribution of Materials to Promote Herbal Cultivation in Uttarakhand - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: Under this scheme, there is a special provision for the free distribution of seeds or saplings of medicinal plants up to 3 nali and seeds or saplings of aromatic plants up to 5 nali to farmers belonging to border districts, Scheduled Castes/Tribes, and Below Poverty Line (BPL) categories.
tags: ['Distribution Of Saplings', 'Distribution Of Seeds', 'Farmer', 'Herbal', 'Herbal Research', 'Medicinal Plant']

name: Financial Assistance to the Family of Temple Employees
description: The scheme aims to grant financial assistance to the family of the temple employee who expires while in service. The scheme provides an amount of ₹5,000/- under the Group Insurance Scheme and an amount of ₹20,000/- under the Chief Minister’s Welfare Fund. The applications are accepted offline.

name: Financial Incentives for Certification and Intellectual Property Rights Reimbursement Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide financial incentives to industrial units, hospitals, and educational institutions in the State of Goa to obtain quality certifications and register Intellectual Property Rights, thereby enhancing their competitive strength in global markets and promoting innovation.

name: Issuing Legal Production Certificate (LPC) to Producers of Medicinal Plant Products for Export - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: The scheme aims to facilitate the lawful export of endangered and CITES-listed medicinal plant species such as Kuth, Kutki, etc. by issuing Legal Production Certificates (LPC) to cultivators who legally grow these species on their own measured land.
tags: ['Export Of Products', 'Herbal Products', 'Herbs', 'Legal Production Certificate', 'Medicinal Plant']

name: Vegetable Area Expansion
description: The scheme aims to promote and expand vegetable cultivation across the state by providing seasonal vegetable seeds to farmers at a 50% subsidy.

name: Registration of Herb Cultivators - Herbal Research and Development Institute, Uttarakhand
description: It aims to register cultivators who grow medicinal and aromatic plants, make the process of using their cultivated herbs easier, and stop the illegal collection of herbs from forests.

name: Mushroom Production and Marketing Scheme
description: The scheme aims to promote mushroom cultivation among farmers by providing subsidized inputs, training, and support for marketing, thereby increasing their income and encouraging entrepreneurship in the sector.

name: Spice Area Expansion
description: The scheme aims to promote and expand the cultivation of high-value spices such as ginger, chili, turmeric, and garlic among farmers by providing quality seeds and tubers at a subsidized rate, thereby increasing spice production and enhancing farmers’ income in Uttarakhand.

name: Scheme Of Assistance To Good Borrowers: ‘A’ Category
description: The scheme aims to provide special financial assistance to existing good borrowers who have maintained an excellent track record of timely repayment. Benefits include term loans up to ₹150,00,000/- and an interest rate concession of 1% less than the normal rate for modernization, expansion, etc.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi
state: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
description: Farmer welfare scheme by Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare to provide income support to all landholding farmers' families in the country to supplement their financial needs for procuring various inputs related to agriculture and allied activities as well as domestic needs.

name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
description: AB PM-JAY is a health insurance scheme for low-income families in rural and urban areas. The scheme aims to provide affordable healthcare facilities to the Poor. It is the largest health assurance scheme in the world which aims at providing a health cover of ₹5,00,000/- per family per year.

name: Surakshit Matritva Aashwasan Yojana
description: SUMAN Yojana is a maternity benefit initiative by MoH&FW. This program provides affordable and quality healthcare solutions to pregnant women and newborns. The scheme provides zero expense access up to six months after delivery. Upto antenatal check-ups during the 1st trimester are provided.

name: Ladli Beti Scheme
description: A social assistance scheme sponsored by the J&K Govt. for newborn girl children born on or after 01/04/2015. The objective is to arrest the declining female sex ratio. The scheme ensures that the girl child does not become a burden for the parent or guardian at the time of her marriage.

name: Self Employment Scheme For Rehabilitation Of Manual Scavengers
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: The Self Employment Scheme for Rehabilitation of Manual Scavengers (SRMS) was introduced in January 2017 by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, to assist the identified manual scavengers and their dependants in rehabilitation in alternative occupations.

name: Mukhyamantri Kanyadaan Yojana
description: Mukhyamantri Kanyadaan Yojana launched by Social Justice and empowerment in 2015 by Rajasthan for Family provides financial support to eligible families to help them cover the expenses associated with their daughters' weddings.
tags: ['DBT Scheme', 'Female Scheme', 'Girls Scheme Rajasthan', 'Kanyadaan Yojana', 'Social Welfare']

name: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance
description: "Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance" is a scheme by the Chief Minister's Secretariat, Govt. of Rajasthan. In case of death due to accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided. In case of serious injury, assistance is up to ₹ 20,000. The assistance is "one-time full-support".

name: Chief Minister Housing Assistance Programme
description: The scheme "Chief Minister’s Housing Assistance Programme" by the Housing Department, Government of Meghalaya, aims to provide durable housing to EWS and LIG families. Through this scheme, roofing materials and dwelling houses are provided to eligible families in the State.

name: Green Passage Scheme
description: The "Green Passage Scheme" Scheme provides free higher education to children without biological or adoptive parents. After the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, the scheme was revised to as well cover children who lost their both parents or single parent during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Vivah Sahayata Yojana
description: "Vivah Sahayata Yojana" is a scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 30,000/- (Rupees Thirty Thousand Only) rupees for the marriage of two children / female members of the family.

name: National Family Benefit Scheme - Sikkim
description: The scheme “National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS)” was launched in 2016 by the Department of Women & Child Welfare, Govt. of Sikkim. Under this scheme, a lump sum amount of ₹ 30,000/- as financial assistance is provided to the bereaved household in the event of the death of the "Primary breadwinner"

name: Maintenance Of Pregnant Desi/Indigenous Cow/Buffalo Ration Scheme For BPL Families Belonging To Scheduled Caste (SC) Category
description: A scheme had been launched by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh with the aim to provides a 50% subsidy on a balanced ration for pregnant cows or buffalo during the last trimester of pregnancy.

name: Krishak Durghatna Kalyan Yojana
description: The government will provide compensation to the farmers after any accident.

name: Rashtriya Parivar Sahayata Yojana
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: This scheme is being executed for the family members who are unable to make their livelihood after the death of the primary breadwinner of the family.

name: KALIA Scholarship
description: The objective of the scheme is to extend financial assistance to the children of the beneficiaries under KALIA for pursuing Professional/Technical courses in the State of Odisha.

name: Educational Assistance to Children of Women Headed Families
description: The scheme “Educational Assistance to Children of Women Headed Families” was launched by the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala. The scheme proposes to extend a helping hand to women-headed families by way of providing financial assistance to the education of children.

name: Tripura Lynching/Mob Violence Victim Compensation Scheme
description: The “Tripura Lynching/Mob Violence Victim Compensation Scheme” was launched by the Home Department, Govt. of Tripura on 14th August 2018 for providing funds for the purpose of compensation to the victim or his dependents who have suffered loss or injury as a result of lynching/mob violence.

name: "Immediate Relief Assistance" under "Welfare and Relief for Fishermen During Lean Seasons and Natural Calamities Scheme"
description: The scheme "Immediate Relief Assistance" under "Welfare and Relief for Fishermen During Lean Seasons and Natural Calamities Scheme" is introduced to extend financial assistance to the fishermen's families to compensate for the loss due to the missing breadwinner and to support them financially.

name: Grant Of Incentive For Marriage Between Differently Abled Person And Normal Persons
description: “Grant Of Incentive For Marriage Between Differently Abled Person And Normal Persons” by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry supports marriages between differently-abled individuals and those without disabilities. An incentive of ₹1,00,000/- is provided (₹20,000 as cash, and ₹80 as NSC).

name: Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Audhan Yojana
description: In order to give financial support to the aggrieved family members of the ill-fated farmers the State Govt. has provided accident claim cover through Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Audhan Yojana in the year 2023-24.

name: Shubhshakti Yojana
description: The Shubshakti Yojana has been initiated by the Rajasthan government with the aim of providing financial assistance to regular construction workers, unmarried laborers, and their daughters.

name: Medical Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides medical assistance to the Building & Other Construction Workers, who are registered under the A&N Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and his/her dependents' family members during hospitalization due to accident or illness.

name: Death Benefit (ANBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides financial assistance to the nominees or dependents of workers engaged in Building or Other Construction Works in Andaman & Nicobar Islands in the event of their natural or accidental death.

name: Shiksha Protsaahan Puraskaar yojana
description: By the Labour Department of Madhya Pradesh, a scheme (Shiksha Protsahan Puraskar Yojana) was initiated for the financial assistance to the children.

name: Shree Nanaji Deshmukh Awas Yojana (GBOCWWB)
description: In urban areas, where EWS/LIG houses have been allotted by Local Self-Government Organization/Urban Development Authority & Gujarat Housing Board under Chief Minister/Prime Minister Awas Yojana, the benefit of this scheme is given once per family to construction worker registered in the board.

name: Dattopant Thengadi Mratak Shramik Aarthik Sahayata Yojana
description: The Government of Uttar Pradesh initiated a scheme "Dattopant Thengadee Mrtak Shramik Aarthik Sahaayata Yojana" to the families of deceased workers.

name: Financial Assistance for Coaching Classes (HBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹20,000/- for coaching classes for admission of children of registered workers in professional/technical courses and ₹1,00,000/- for preparation of Main Examination on passing Preliminary Examination of UPSC/HPSSC.

name: Fare for Visiting Home Town (HBOCWWB)
description: Under this scheme, a free traveling facility to visit the hometown once in a year for a family not exceeding 5 members is provided to the registered construction workers who have a minimum of two year’s regular membership of the Board.

name: Financial Assistance in Marriage of Women Workers or Daughters of Workers- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹51,000/- is provided to workers employed in the industrial & commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for the marriage of their daughters and for the self-marriage of the working women workers as Kanyadaan.

name: Pension for Journalists’ Family
description: The "Pension for Journalists’ Family" was launched by the Tamil Development, Religious Endowments, and Information Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to give a monthly pension to the wife of a deceased journalist pensioner.

name: Financial Assistance for Encouraging Worker's Children's Participation in Sports Activities- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the children of the workers working in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for participating in sports competitions so that the children of the workers can also become good sportspersons.

name: Financial Assistance for Working Women Workers or Wives of Male Workers for Maternity- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹10,000/- is provided to female workers and wives of male workers working in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana for the delivery of up to two children (three girls or two boys).

name: Scholarship Scheme for Worker's Children- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to children of workers & workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions of Haryana state to continue their studies.

name: Assistance for Marriage
description: The scheme "Assistance for Marriage" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, a sum of ₹2,000/- is given to meet the marriage expenses of the differently abled person or his son or daughter.

name: Assistance on Death- Haryana Silicosis Board
description: Under this scheme, in case of death of the Silicosis victim, financial assistance of ₹1,00,000/- will be payable to the widow or widower if the deceased was married, or to his/her nominee in case deceased was unmarried.

name: Funeral Assistance- Haryana Silicosis Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is given to the dependent/nominee of a deceased worker, who was confirmed to have Silicosis by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, for performing the funerary rituals.

name: Mukhyamantri Nikah Yojana
description: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to the needy girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor Muslim families in the state at the time of their marriage (In case of mass marriage).

name: Shagun Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Shagun Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial support for the marriage of up to two daughters of registered workmen, including daughters who are registered beneficiaries.

name: General Surgery Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "General Surgery Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for general surgery of the beneficiary and his family members.

name: Cycle Scheme for the Children of Construction Workers (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Cycle Scheme for the Children of Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides free cycles to the children of registered construction workers once during the period they study in 9th to 12th class in the State of Punjab.

name: Urban Health Kiosk Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Urban Health Kiosk Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that aims to provide primary health facilities to the construction workers & their families in urban health kiosks run by Punjab Health Society in slum areas.

name: Mobile Lab Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Mobile Lab Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides reimbursement of expenditure incurred by the beneficiaries and their dependents for the treatment of silicosis.

name: Antarjatiye Vivah Protsahan Anudan Yojana
description: The objective of this scheme is to end the caste system in the state and encourage inter-caste marriages by providing financial assistance to couples. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries will receive a one-time grant of ₹1,00,000/-. This scheme is fully funded by the Government of Bihar.

name: Jharkhand Mukhyamantri Maiya Samman Yojana
description: The "Jharkhand Mukhyamantri Maiya Samman Yojana" provides financial assistance to women beneficiaries. This initiative aims to enhance the financial security and well-being of women across the state.

name: Kabir Anthyesthi Anudan Yojana
description: Under this scheme, a one-time grant of ₹3,000/- is given to the family/dependent of the deceased to cover funeral expenses. The grant is provided for the death of any person of any age from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.

name: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award
description: The scheme provides financial assistance to one boy and one girl from the SC/ST community (Hindu Adi Dravidar) in each district who secure the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations.

name: Pension to the Beneficiary Building Worker Who Has Completed 60 Years
description: The Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board provides a monthly pension to workers who have completed 5 years of service as a registered beneficiary and reached 60.

name: Natural Death Relief (MBOCWWB)
description: The "Natural Death Relief" scheme launched by the Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board provides financial assistance to the kith and kin of a registered building worker in the event of the worker's natural death.

name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Assistance for Education of Children
description: This scheme provides financial support to beneficiaries for their children's (maximum two) education at various levels, including higher secondary, graduation, post-graduation, and professional courses like engineering and medical studies.

name: Pension Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
description: The "Pension Scheme" by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Himachal Pradesh provides registered beneficiaries with a minimum pension of ₹1,000/- per month upon reaching 60 years of age.

name: Funeral Support Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
description: The "Funeral Support Scheme" under the Labour and Employment Department, Himachal Pradesh, provides ₹20,000 to the nominees or dependents of registered beneficiaries to support funeral expenses.

name: Jharkhand Mukhyamantri Shramik Yojana
description: The "Mukhyamantri Shramik Yojana" scheme by the Urban Development & Housing Department, Government of Jharkhand aims to provide guaranteed employment to unskilled urban workers. It offers up to 100 days of employment in urban development projects.

name: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
description: In the scheme "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit" by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, an amount of ₹20,000/- per annum is provided to the registered workers to take care of their mentally retarded/disabled children.

name: Family Pension (BBOCWWB)
description: The scheme "Family Pension" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BBOCWWB), Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides pension to the dependent of the deceased pensioner of the Board.

name: Death Assistance Scheme (BBOCWWB)
description: The "Death Assistance" scheme provides financial assistance to the legal heir in the case of natural death or accidental death of the registered worker. If the death occurs during a disaster and a grant has already been given by Disaster Management, only ₹1,00,000/- will be payable by the Board.

name: Financial Assistance for Cremation (BBOCWWB)
description: The scheme "Financial Assistance for Cremation" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides financial assistance of ₹5,000/-to the dependents of the deceased worker for performing cremation.

name: Birsa Harit Gram Yojana
description: The "Birsa Harit Gram Yojana" by the Rural Development Department, Government of Jharkhand, promotes afforestation while generating sustainable livelihoods. It supports SC, ST, and landless families through plantation activities under MGNREGA, ensuring income and environmental sustainability.

name: Vishesh Yogyajan Sukhad Dampatya Jeevan Yojana
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to specially-abled individuals to support a happy married life after marriage. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000/- per couple is provided.

name: Bunkar Parivar Sahayata Yojana
description: "Bunkar Parivar Sahayata Yojana" aims to provide immediate financial assistance to families of weavers in case of sudden death. The scheme benefits the families of working weavers who are members of primary weaver cooperative societies by providing financial support of ₹20,000/-.

name: Incentive for Inter-Caste Marriage Scheme
description: "Incentive For Inter Caste Marriage" aims to promote inter-caste marriages between SC and non-SC communities to combat casteism. The scheme provides a financial incentive of ₹50,000/- to eligible couples, with either spouse being a permanent resident of NCT of Delhi.

name: Mukhyamantri Nishulk Gas Refill Yojana
description: The scheme aims to support poor families by reducing their household fuel expenses. Under this scheme, Antyodaya (pink card) ration card holders in the state are entitled to receive three free gas cylinder refills every year.

name: Kaidi Sahay Yojana
description: The "Kaidi Sahay Yojana" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/- to the family of a prisoner who is the sole or main earner, to support them through self-employment.

name: Humara Ped Humara Dhan
description: The scheme aims to encourage residents of Uttarakhand to plant and protect trees on their private land by providing financial incentives, thereby promoting environmental conservation, increasing green cover, and linking economic benefits with tree plantation.

name: Solar Home System (Manohar Jyoti)
description: The "Solar Home System (Manohar Jyoti)" by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana, aims to promote renewable energy adoption and ensure sustainable power access through solar solutions. Through this scheme, a subsidized solar home lighting system is provided to families.

name: Solar Inverter Charger
description: The "Solar Inverter Charger" by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana, aims to promote the use of renewable energy and reduce electricity dependence by providing a subsidy of ₹6,000/- or ₹10,000/- for solar inverter charger systems to eligible households.

name: National Family Benefit Scheme - Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to provide social security to Below Poverty Line (BPL) households. Under the scheme, a one-time lump sum assistance of ₹20,000 is provided to the widow or unmarried daughter of the deceased, if the primary breadwinner, aged between 18 and 59 years, passes away.

name: Rental Housing Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide rental housing to individuals and families from lower and middle-income groups, address housing shortages, prevent unauthorized settlements, and promote orderly urban development. It benefits Grade Third and Grade Fourth employees and eligible non-government individuals.

name: Zupda Vijlikaran Yojana
description: Under this scheme, free household electricity connections are given to the BPL /Lower income group households across the state.

name: Shahidvir Kinariwaala Student Security Group Insurance Scheme
description: The scheme provides financial protection in case of accidental death or permanent disability to students or their guardians/heirs to help reduce the burden during unforeseen tragedies. The scheme covers students at Government and Non-Government Colleges, Gram Vidyapeeth GBTC colleges, etc.

name: National Family Benefit Scheme
description: A family welfare scheme under the umbrella scheme ‘National Social Assistance Programme’ (NSAP) by MoRD. In this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the bereaved households in case of the death of the primary breadwinner irrespective of the cause of death.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
state: Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
description: A scheme by Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas for Providing free LPG connections to women belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.

name: Tripura Scheme For Incentive To Girl Child
description: The scheme aims to provide an incentive to girl children. Through this scheme, an incentive is offered to the mother of the girl child or her legal guardian on a monthly basis.

name: Janta Juth Accidental Insurance Scheme
description: "Janta Juth" is a Farmer's Accidental Insurance Scheme by the Govt. of Gujarat to provide economic assistance of upto ₹ 2,00,000 to Farmers in case of Death or Disability. The objective is to assist the successor of the farmer in case of death or disability due to an accident.

name: Building And Other Construction Scholarship
description: The Skill Development & Technical Education Department launched the BOC Scholarship on 1 December 2022 so that the students pursuing or undertaking technical education will be able to pursue it finally without facing any kind of financial difficulties.

name: Chief Minister's COVID-19 Affected Livelihood Support Scheme
description: The guidelines of the "Chief Minister's COVID-19 Affected Livelihood Support Scheme" were approved by the Dept. of Social Welfare, Govt. of Manipur. The COVID-19 Pandemic and the resulting economic dislocations have severely affected the livelihood of a large percentage of the population.

name: Silpi Pension Scheme - Assam
description: Silpi Pension Scheme is a Welfare Scheme provided by the Government of Assam to support the Artists of Assam. Those artists and families who have made outstanding contributions in the field of Art and Culture of Assam will be given financial aid and Pension.

name: Parivaar Pension Yojana (JBOCWWB)
description: "Parivaar Pension Yojana (JBOCWWB)" is a scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. The scheme provides 50% of the pension amount or a maximum of ₹ 500/- to the family members of the deceased pensioner.

name: Mamta Taruni Abhiyan
description: "Mamta Taruni Abhiyan" was a program launched in Gujarat, India, aimed at providing healthcare facilities to adolescent girls and pregnant women in rural areas. The program was launched by the Gujarat state government in 2010.

name: NIJASHAREE HOUSING SCHEME
description: The scheme “NIJASHAREE HOUSING SCHEME” is an initiative by the Govt. of West Bengal which envisages the construction of multi-storied Lower Income Group (LIG)/Middle Income Group (MIG) flats on the public lands belonging to the State Government, local bodies and parastatals.

name: Death Benefit Scheme (APB&OCWWB)
description: The scheme “Death Benefit Scheme” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for registered workers of the Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).

name: Funeral Financial Assistant (APB&OCWWB)
description: The scheme “Funeral Financial Assistant” was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for the registered workers of Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).

name: Biju Swasthya Kalyan Yojana
description: Biju Swasthya Kalyan Yojana (BSKY) has been launched by the Department of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Odisha as a path-breaking program to provide universal health coverage, with special emphasis on the health protection of vulnerable families and women.

name: Death Assistance For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
description: The scheme “Death Assistance for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

name: Self-Employment Scheme For Dependents Of Prisoners
description: The scheme “Self-Employment Scheme for Dependents of Prisoners” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

name: Relief and Rehabilitation Assistance to Sri Lankan Refugees in the Refugee Camps
description: The scheme provides relief materials, which among other things include Feeding Charges, Subsidized Rice, Clothing Materials, Utensils, Transportation Charges (on arrival), Porterage and Transport (on repatriation), Cash Doles, Infrastructure Facilities (at camps), Electricity, Drinking Water, etc.

name: Kalyana Lakshmi Pathakam
description: The scheme is designed to support economically disadvantaged families belonging to the SC/ST and minority communities by providing one-time financial assistance for the marriage of their daughters.

name: Lean Season Assistance under "Welfare and Relief for Fishermen During Lean Seasons and Natural Calamities Scheme"
description: The scheme "Lean Season Assistance" under "Welfare and Relief for Fishermen During Lean Seasons and Natural Calamities Scheme" is introduced with the objective of assisting fishermen families who are deprived of income during natural calamities and fishing ban periods.

name: Gopabandhu Sambadika Swasthya Bima Yojana
description: The “Gopabandhu Sambadika Swasthya Bima Yojana” was launched by the Information & Public Relations Department, Govt. of Odisha. It is a health insurance scheme that covers the medical expenses of the journalists and their eligible family members.

name: Grant of Incentive for Marriage Between Differently Abled Person
description: Through this scheme, an incentive of ₹2,00,000/- is provided, comprising ₹40,000 in cash and ₹1,60,000/- in the form of a National Savings Certificate (NSC), for the marriage between differently-abled individuals. The selection is periodical and depends on the availability of funds.

name: Financial Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Funeral Rites
description: “Financial Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Funeral Rites” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Scheduled Caste family for performing funeral rites of their deceased family member.

name: Tea Development Scheme
description: The objective of the scheme is to continue the experimental plantation of tea and to find the possibility of growing tea economically as well as on a commercial scale.

name: Funeral Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides financial assistance to the nominees or dependents of deceased workers who were registered under the A&N Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, towards their funeral expenses.

name: Educational Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
description: This scheme provides educational assistance to the son or daughter of a registered construction worker who is studying in any class from Class I to Post Graduate Level/Professional Course.

name: Prasuti Sahayata Yojana
description: The Rajasthan Prasuti Sahayata Yojana is a scheme launched by the Government of Rajasthan to provide financial assistance to pregnant women from registered construction worker families in the state

name: Marriage Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
description: Under this scheme, registered construction workers will receive a financial allowance to cover either their own marriage expenses or those of their two dependent children.

name: Khiladi Protsahan Yojana
description: In 2017, the Madhya Pradesh Labour Department initiated the Khilaadee Protsaahan Yojana to provide financial assistance to players.

name: Marriage Assistance Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
description: "Marriage Assistance" is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. In this scheme, financial assistance of ₹7,000/- is provided to the registered construction workers of the Board for the marriage of their children. The benefits are credited via DBT.

name: Satyvadi Raja Harishchandra Marnotar Sahay Yojana
description: The scheme was launched in the year 2000 to provide financial assistance to scheduled caste families at the time of the death of a family member to cover funeral expenses, due to their poor economic conditions.

name: Karma Sathi Prakalpa
description: The scheme aims to help young entrepreneurs in the state establish new manufacturing enterprises and small businesses, including those offering services and trading. The scheme offers soft loans and subsidies for new income-generating projects.

name: Incentives for Meritorious Children (Students) of Workers (10th and 12th Class) (HBOCWWB)
description: Under this scheme, the scholarship (prize money) in the form of fixed deposit will be provided to meritorious children of construction workers who have achieved academic excellence in Class X/XII examination.

name: Marriage Assistance - Folk Artist
description: The scheme "Marriage Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme provides financial assistance for the marriage of registered folk artists, or their son or daughter. The assistance aims to support the cultural community by helping with marriage.

name: Financial Assistance to Workers with a Visually, Physically or Mentally Disabled Child- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the disabled (blind, mentally retarded, mute and deaf) children of registered workers employed in industrial and commercial establishments in the state of Haryana.

name: Financial Assistance for Encouraging Worker's Children's Participation in Cultural Activities- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the children of the workers working in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for participating in cultural competitions so that the children of the workers can also become good artists.

name: Scheme of Death Benefit for Weavers & Artisans of West Bengal
description: "Scheme of Death Benefit for Weavers & Artisans of West Bengal" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles, Government of West Bengal aims to provide financial assistance to the family of the deceased weaver /artisan.

name: Financial Assistance for Artificial Limbs to Workers and their Dependents- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided for artificial limbs upto rates fixed by Saket Hospital, Chandimandir(Panchkula). This assistance is available to workers employed in industrial &commercial units in Haryana and their dependents, who become disabled due to the loss of vital organs.

name: Mukhya Mantri Sharmik Surksha Yojana- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- will be provided to the widows/dependents of workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions in Haryana, in the event of the worker's death while working at the workplace.

name: Family Pension- Haryana Silicosis Board
description: Under this scheme, after the death of the worker due to Silicosis, financial assistance of ₹3,500/- per month is provided to the spouse of the worker until he/she remains alive. In the case of an unmarried worker, the financial assistance is provided to his/her living parents.

name: Financial Assistance for Coaching- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
description: The objective of the scheme to provide financial assistance up to ₹20,000/- for coaching of entrance examinations for professional courses and ₹1,00,000/- to the children of workers for preparing for the main examination on passing the preliminary examination of UPSC and HPSC.

name: Relief to the Unregistered Workers
description: The "Relief to the Unregistered Workers" scheme was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F Dept. Telangana aimed to provide financial assistance to the dependents of unregistered building & construction workers who die in accidents at construction sites.

name: Denture, Spectacles & Hearing Aid Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Denture, Spectacles & Hearing Aid Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial aid to beneficiary construction workers & their families for denture, spectacles & hearing aid.

name: Family/ Widow Pension Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Family/ Widow Pension Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides pension to the spouse of a registered construction worker in the event of his/ her death.

name: Physical Research Laboratory Award
description: The PRL Award, instituted by the late Prof. Devendra Lal, former Director of the Physical Research Laboratory (PRL), is awarded biennially to recognize outstanding Indian scientists for original work in Earth & Planetary systems, including areas like Oceanography, Atmospheric Sciences & Meteorology.

name: Marriage Gift Scheme (APBOCWWB)
description: The Andhra Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers have introduced the "Marriage Gift Scheme" for registered unmarried women workers & the two daughters of registered construction workers. This welfare initiative aims to provide financial assistance on the occasion of their marriage

name: Medical Assistance (NBOCWWB)
description: The "Medical Assistance" scheme by the Nagaland Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board provides financial assistance to registered beneficiaries and their family members for hospitalization.

name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Medical Benefit for Major Ailments
description: This scheme provides financial assistance for the treatment of beneficiaries or their family members suffering from major ailments like cancer, TB, brain stroke, cardiac problems, and others.

name: Award for Success in State Public Service Commission, Union Public Service Commission Examination (MPBOCWWB)
description: The State Public Service Commission and Union Public Service Commission Examination Success Award Scheme, 2012 provides an incentive to sons and daughters of registered construction workers, up to 45 years of age, selected in State or Union Public Service Commission exams.

name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Funeral Expenses
description: The scheme provides monetary support to help cover funeral costs in the unfortunate event of a beneficiary's demise.

name: Jharkhand International Migrant Workers Grant Scheme
description: The "Chief Minister Jharkhand International Migrant Worker Grant Scheme" aims to provide financial assistance to the dependents of Jharkhand residents who pass away while working abroad. This scheme ensures timely support to families affected by unforeseen tragedies during overseas employment.

name: Jharkhand Petrol Subsidy Scheme
description: The scheme "Petrol Subsidy Scheme" implemented by the Food, Public Distribution & Consumer Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide a petrol subsidy of ₹250 per month for two-wheelers to eligible NFSA/Jharkhand State Food Security Scheme beneficiaries.

name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Antyodaya Parivar Suraksha Yojana (DAYALU)
description: The objective of this scheme is to provide socio-financial security to eligible residents of Haryana. The scheme provides financial assistance in the event of death (natural/accidental) or permanent disability (caused by an accident) of a family member whose annual income is less than ₹1.80 lakh.

name: Noni Suraksha Yojana
description: The scheme aims to improve the educational and health status of girls, lay the foundation for their bright future, prevent female feticide, promote a positive attitude towards the birth of girls, and prevent child marriage.  It provides financial benefit to girls who remain unmarried until 18 years.

name: Samman Bhatta to War Widows and Parents of Martyrs
description: The scheme aims to provide lifelong financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per month to war widows and parents of unmarried martyrs who sacrificed their lives in various wars, counter-insurgency operations, and aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999.

name: Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme
description: The "Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support the families of Gujarat's active fishermen by offering monetary compensation in case of accidental fatalities.

name: Financial Assistance After Death (UKBOCWWB)
description: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹2 lakh in case of natural death and ₹4 lakh in case of accidental death to the dependents of registered construction workers.

name: National Family Benefit Scheme (Punjab)
description: The scheme "National Family Benefit Scheme (Punjab)" by the Department of Social Security and Development of Women and Children, Government of Punjab, provides a lump sum assistance of ₹20,000/- is provided to the bereaved household in the event of the death of their breadwinner.

name: Palak Mata-Pita Yojana
description: The "Palak Mata-Pita Yojana" introduced on 29th August, 2009 by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides a monthly assistance of ₹3000 to foster parents raising orphaned children or children whose mother has remarried after the father's death.

name: Group Accident Insurance Scheme under PMMSY: Permanent Partial Disability Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to fishermen/fishermen's families in case of death or injury. Through this scheme, insurance coverage for Permanent Partial Disability is provided to eligible fishers.

name: Group Accident Insurance Scheme under PMMSY: Medical Treatment - Gujarat
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to fishermen/fishermen's families in case of death or injury. Through this scheme, insurance coverage for Medical Treatment is provided to eligible fishers.

name: Assistance for Damage to Agricultural Land and Other Losses
description: The scheme aims to provide financial relief to farmers whose agricultural land has been damaged due to natural disasters such as floods, landslides, avalanches, or river diversions. Under this scheme, a minimum of ₹5,000/- and a maximum of ₹47,000/- is provided to the beneficiaries.

name: Ex-Gratia Grant for Clothes, Utensils, and Household Items to Disaster-Affected Families
description: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to disaster-affected families for clothes, utensils, or household items in cases where their house has been washed away, completely or substantially damaged due to a natural calamity, or affected by waterlogging for a period of more than two days.

name: Sardar Krushi Jyoti Yojana
description: The scheme improves power supply for farmers by replacing old wires and equipment and upgrading agricultural feeders for uninterrupted service, which is crucial for irrigation.

name: Madhya Pradesh Crime Victim Compensation Scheme
description: The scheme aims to provide financial compensation and rehabilitation to victims of crime or their dependents by offering monetary support, medical treatment, and rehabilitation based on their loss, injury, and financial status.

name: Swachh Bharat Mission – Urban 2.0
description: A sanitation scheme for the construction of Individual Household Latrines (IHHL) for urban households.

name: Revised Education Scheme For Children Of Artisans/Weavers Of Handicrafts And Handloom Departments
